Reviews.Title: “The prettiest hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kmmcq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Istanbul. First of all, it is a wonderful city, a definite must see. It is clean, the people are friendly, there is so much to see and do. I have never seen so many flowers!!!! We had the great good fortune of staying at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. The location can't be beat, but beyond that, the hotel is simply lovely. It is comfortable, well designed, and staffed with caring individuals who see to it that you have a wonderful visit to their little bit of paradise. Many early mornings after breakfast, we would spend time in the courtyard just enjoying its beauty. The fragrant flowers just added to its ambiance. After a long day, we had a galss of wine on the rooftop terrace with the views that are unsurpassed anywhere. I absolutely love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like winning the lottery!”
Reviews.Author: CherylNS
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a perfect location - close to everything but on a quiet back street. Every detail has been considered and the amazing staff was attentive at all times. I have never felt so taken care of. Beautiful rooms, lovely courtyard where we enjoyed our breakfast each morning - the only thing I could have wished for was hotter water in my shower. The food was okay, not bad, but not exceptional either. The spa on the other hand was an added bonus. They wash your feet with rose water in a beautiful candle lit room! Great massage. This is the way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique property in a special location”
Reviews.Author: Socalicouple
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has done something quite unique with their beautiful property in Sultanahmet in the heart of the old city in Istanbul. A small, boutique feel along with the Four Seasons brand of quality and service combine and the result is a property that provides an island of serenity and comfort in the middle of the bustling of one of the great crossroad cities in the world. The layout is an old prison, but you have to wildly stretch the imagination to conjure up any of that past. Highlights include having a drink on the rooftop terrace, the Bosphorous behind you and the Hagia Sofia right in front of you. You can feel the history and commerce all around you. The staff is meticulous, and beyond what you can experience at other five star hotels, it almost feels like each of the staff are hosting you in their own place. That feeling is helped by the small size, with less than 70 rooms. The courtyard is a flowered garden to rest and recharge. I was unfortunately there for a brief work visit of one day/night, but if you want a great location to settle in and explore Istanbul, this is a super spot to base out of for a few days

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, it can't get better!”
Reviews.Author: happy_world_travels
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons at Sultanahmet was one of the high points of our stay at Istanbul. They were in touch with us even before we landed and offered to accommodate our changes of flight and arrival time. The General Manager, Mr. Felix Murillo, was really helpful and always accessible. Their attention to detail is excellent - one evening, one of the screens in our room did not close completely and they had someone come over within minutes to fix it. The rooms themselves are very well maintained and evoke clear connections with the past. The restaurant is beautiful and the hotel grounds look stunning at night. It is within walking distance of the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and many other attractions and the hotel staff are more than willing to help out with questions and information. They accommodated our every need (delayed luggage, missing stuff) and it was fabulous. We could not have chosen a better place to stay in Istanbul, we sorely missed it when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel - stunning conversion of an old prison. Restaurant is a must and deserves all the acolades

Reviews.Title: “First class experience that couldn't be more convenient”
Reviews.Author: americantravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and son over the Easter break. It's a fabulous property. The rooms are superbly furnished, with really wonderful bathrooms - no amenity overlooked. For example, the hotel provided an iPad in our room that my son latched onto for the entire visit. The bathroom included both a whirlpool tub and a shower room with a steam setting. The toiletries were Bulgari. We had a suite, which was spacious and big enough to easily accommodate my son in the main living room. The staff were equally wonderful. No request too small to handle. We arranged a guided tour, car service, and a private boat ride through them. Breakfast was a treat, with the usual hotel fare plus local specialties (Turkish breads, cheeses, honeycomb, etc.). We dined in the hotel restaurant one night and also enjoyed that meal. Apart from the sheer fabulousness of the property and service, the hotel is extremely convenient for sightseeing. Definitely a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous End of Trip”
Reviews.Author: DMLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our week at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet capped a five plus week 50th anniversary trip for my wife and me. Our stay in Istanbul, and the Four Seasons in particular, was wonderful. The hotel's location is phenomenal. While there are many other hotels of varying sizes nearby, none comes even close to offering the luxury that the Four Seasons offers. The location cannot be beat if one is interested in the history of Constantinople, the greatest city of the western world for nearly 1,000 years. Within a five minute walk are four of the world's greatest cultural sites - Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia Museum (1500 year old former Byzantine cathedral and then mosque), the Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cistern. Every one of these is a jaw-dropping experience. Even public transportation - frowned on by the hotel - is within 5 minutes. Enough about location within a spectacular city. The hotel itself is simply wonderful. Our room was very spacious, although at the bottom of the ladder for price and size. The bathroom is large, elegant, and fully outfitted with absolutely top of the line linens and toiletries. There was morning and evening maid service and fresh fruit and water on a daily basis. Nothing was left out. The hotel is immaculate, heavily staffed, beautifully conceived, and ultra service oriented and worth every penny of the cost, which was high to say the least. My only quibble is that the one dinner we ate there was only OK. On the other hand, we had a delicious lunch at the sister hotel overlooking the Bosphorus. For an impeccable location and great experience, this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Prison now a Pleasure Palace. Location and staff make for an exceptional experience of Old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: C R
Reviews.Content: My husband booked my son and I into the Istanbul Sultanahmet 4 Seasons because he knew that we would be well taken care of, be extremely comfortable, and feel very safe based on his previous experience. The staff is exceptionally friendly, professional, knowledgeable and efficient. The hotel was a Turkish prison, which is not detectable, but good for humourous stories. The hotel itself is steps away from the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and a relatively easy walk to the Tokapi Palace (1 of the 2 former Sultan's Palaces in Istanbul). The staff just couldn't be more personable or accommodating. Very luxurious and service-oriented and provide a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic hotel for any season”
Reviews.Author: Pamela L
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a delightful stay at the Four Seasons hotel,Sultanhamet,where all our expectations were fulfilled and exceeded.This superb hotel,admirably managed by the charming Mr Felix Murillo is within easy walking distance of Sultanalmet Mosque,Topkapi Palace museum,Hagia Sophia museum,and many other attractions.A little further away ,but most highly recommended is the Koska confectionary shop.The best selection of turkish delights,baklavas,nuts and cakes imaginable. The hotel's entrance hall is a florist's dream.Beautiful floral arrangements artistically displayed.Different flower themes extended to all parts of the hotel and gave us great pleasure. Our elegantly furnished room on the 2nd floor overlooked the garden,and conservatory restaurant.Our room was faultlessly cleaned and replenished daily with bottled water,and a basket of fresh fruit. The garden is breathtaking,the fragrance of hyacinths,the colour combination of various plants and flowers are a credit to the immaculate maintainence and pride the gardeners of the hotel take in their work, We ate in the restaurant,professionally managed by Engen,and his hard working talented chefs,and waiting staff.We particurly enjoyed at breakfast the lage comb of honey,and the delicious conical shaped hot onion,basil and olive breads served at dinner.Try also a basket of tasty french fries availabe in the lounge bar. We were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary and thanks to Mr Murillo and his happy staff they made the occasion memorable.A celebratory cake and sparkling wine greeted our arrival ,and each night we had a delicious and superbly presented rose petalled tray of canapes,petit fours ,macaroons and turkish wines delivered to our room.. Every member of staff was exceceptionally friendly,attentive and dedicated to making our stay a happy and worthwhile experience.It is perphaps churlish to pick out individual staff members,because everyone was so pleasant and helpful.However we were given special attention from Mr Mehmet,Guest Manager,Sinem,Receptionist and TugGe . One expects luxurious toileteries,fluffy robes ,quality bed linen free internet service in 5 star hotels.One also expects,but regretfully does not always receive 5 star service from the staff. At Four Seasons ,Sultanahamet you can rest assured that this is what you will recieve in abundance .

Reviews.Title: “Earthly paradise in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: Some might called it Shangri-La or Nirvana, well, it seems it is located in Istanbul at Sultanahmet. First time visit to Istambul, arrived very late at the hotel after a long transoceanic flight. We were greeted by name at the hotel entrance, no check inn at the lobby, we were inmediatly guided to our room. The room was impecable, everything in order, plus a nice selection or Turquish deserts for our arrival. The hotel is very quiet, perfect pairing for that lovely Four Seasons bed. The grounds of the hotel are full of flowers and small plants, that complement the heavenly atmosphere of the hotel. Everyone on the staff was always a step ahead to serve you, again, greeted by name and always made fell welcome and in the right place in Istambul. All culinary aspects are excellent, the choice ranges from local dishes and spices, to international flavors for the less adventurous. Our only regret at this hotel, is that our visit was too short. For the discriminating traveller, looking for only the best in every sense, this is your address at Istambul. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully situated only steps from Haigha Sophia and the Blue Mosque, service, food and facility are impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: dhkklk
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Ritz Carlton and happened upon this hotel because the Ritz was booked. We are so happy with that turn of events, as the Four Seasons Sultanahmet is easily one of the best hotels we have ever experienced. From the moment we spoke with them with questions about our stay, not one detail was overlooked including the driver from the airport who assisted us with in room check in (a real treat after 17 hour journey), a welcome amenity for our 12 year old daughter, impeccably appointed room and bathroom with a view of the Haigha Sophia, daily treats left in our room, a beautiful breakfast buffet with lovely and attentive wait staff, and the list goes on. This hotel is ideally situated and although we were worried it didn't have a pool, we ended up being glad it didn't as there is so much to enjoy in Istanbul. We are looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and impeccable service in a stunning city”
Reviews.Author: KAB100
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and friends who had lived in there recommended the Four Seasons. When I made the reservations, I mentioned that the trip was to celebrate my husband's birthday. The hotel went out of their way to make the trip memorable; when we checked in, the manager came out to give my husband birthday wishes, and we were upgraded to a suite. At dinner in the restaurant (which is pricey but great food), our meal was finished with a beautiful birthday cake; all of course, very discreetly done. It is these personal touches that makes the Four Seasons worth it. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms quiet and comfortable; the service, as other reviews indicate, unsurpassed. Turkish people overall are so hospitable; one evening we were trying to locate an out of the way restaurant, and rather than get a taxi, the doorman, who was leaving for the day, drove us on his way home! At that same restaurant, the waiter, who spoke only limited English, was charming and attentive and ensured that we knew how to navigate back to the hotel. Istanbul itself is an unforgettable city. The historic and cultural sites are not to be missed and the Four Seasons is in a perfect location for sightseeing. We walked almost everywhere, and were happy to come back and relax in our suite, where we found daily treats at teatime. Overall, there is a warmth and appreciation for visitors in Istanbul that we have not found in other cities. We always felt safe, regardless of the hour, and even when no one spoke English, there was no barrier in communicating in restaurants or cafes. We have traveled extensively, and this hotel and Istanbul are some of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - loved every minute there!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie E
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet was the best decison we made. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are wonderful. It is walking distance to all the historical sites. Can't say enought about the what a great experience we had there. Would love to go back to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S TRUE , IT IS A 10 !!!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelCriticIntl
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Istanbul at Sultanahmet is "heaven on earth". The adventure began with our arrival at Ataturk Airport where we wisely opted to have the hotel send a car for us, and were met by a most welcoming "greeter" who assisted us to the BMW and our driver Ertan. Along the way he graciously gave us a mini tour and answered so many of our questions. As a fine example of the generosity of the impeccable staff, Ertan later guided us to the Whirling Dervish show after he got off of his shift at the hotel. Who does that? I'll tell you who, every team member of the hotel! They become your friends, assisting you with every phase of your trip to Istanbul. Upon entering the flowerful foyer, we were met by Mehmet Nacar, the front desk mgr. who had arranged all of our reservations for restaurants and tours on typed cards in our room (see photo). The hotel itself is full of Ottoman charm, with delicious warm colors throughout and speckled with mounted Turkish tiles along the graceful hallways (see photos). As you enter your room through the large wood doors you find a plush space, our was overlooking the gardens and breakfast area. The bathroom is huge, furnished with tub and separate shower after which you can sink into the luxurious Turkish towels and robes. Five times a day the call to prayer seeps into the window and you know that you are in an exotic land, with a rich culture and great history. In order to facilitate and maximize our time we hired a private guide for 2 days, Seda Karaca came highly recommended and she was a find. The hotel knew her, the shops in the Spice Market and Grand Bazaar knew her, everyone knew her. She accelerated our visits to the sights with no waiting in line. Her tour of the Topkapi Palace was fascinating and detailed. She was a great sport and a lot of fun so try to plan ahead and book her through the hotel concierge. I cannot express to you how helpful the Concierge and reservations dept. were in plannning this holiday. Their attention to detail and professionalism is unmatched. When you book, take advantage of their aid as that is in itself part of the draw to this crown jewel in the Four Seasons realm. Book a breakfast inclusive pkj. and you will enjoy a full buffet with not only American eggs and meat dishes, but an array of breads, olives, honeys, 10 types of cheese, and homemade preserves (try the pomegranate jelly!). I was so impressed one morning when Farkan took the time to explain the origins of the honeycomb hanging on wood stretchers, it was another example of how the hotel is managed and run. And who is at the helm of this amazing oasis? It is FELIX MURILLO, the General Mgr. Twice during our stay we crossed paths. First when he made it a point to introduce himself to us and then upon our departure, as we were leaving for further travels, we saw him again. The goodbye from this kind, generous, and special group of the Four Seasons family was so touching. Mr. Murillo has refined the art of hotel management and I cannot express to any potential visitor to Istanbul that this is THE place to stay when visiting. P.S. Thanks for the birthday cake! (They think of everything)!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the old city”
Reviews.Author: Ongwe
Reviews.Content: We occupied a suite for three ladies; it was fabulous. The location couldn't have been more perfect for wandering the bazaar, spice market, Turkish baths, Blue Mosque, etc. The service at the hotel was wonderful; especially the bowl of Turkish Delight at the registration desk. We wandered out at night and felt perfectly safe. Don't miss staying at this hotel when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in an incredible city”
Reviews.Author: berkeleyCA
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Istanbul and choosing the Four Seasons at Sultanahmet was the first good experience to begin a fabulous trip. The service is impeccable, the rooms were cozy and thoughtfully decorated. I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place amongst historic sites”
Reviews.Author: Melinda W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here & loved the place. If feels very quaint and elegant but not stuffy at all. The service is wonderful. Low key but friendly & warm. We had 2 rooms that were connecting. They were identical except that one was slightly larger. They were very well appointed. Flat screen TV (which we really didn't use), complimentary water bottles, fresh fruit daily, lovely linens and 2 sets of bathrobes - terry & cotton ones. The best thing was there was USA electrical plugs - 2 on the desk & 1 in the bathroom. Very nice detail. The bathroom had a separate shower from the large tub. Toiletries are La Occitane. On our last night, they left Turkish Delight candies in our room for us at turn down. We dined in the restaurant for dinner & breakfast & had great service & the food was quite good. We also had tea in the sunroom area twice & it is a very lovely place to have a Turkish tea. It was too cold to sit outside but it was very pretty & would be a great place to sit in warm weather. We stayed at the other Four Seasons on the Bosphorus also & liked this one much better. If you can afford it, this is a wonderful place to stay while visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but I've had better Four Seasons experiences”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterfam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice stay at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. The location of this hotel could not be better for seeing the sights in the old city. Everything is within walking distance. The staff were extremely friendly, the facilities were very nice. Overall, I think this is a beautiful hotel with very good service, but we left feeling like there were opportunities the hotel didn't take to make this a luxurious experience so associated with the Four Seasons brand. Our room was a very nice hotel room, but... it seemed very dark and a little small. When we checked in we were given an opportunity to upgrade our room for another 75 euro per night. We didn't plan on spending a ton of time in the room, and we've never had a bad room at the Four Seasons before, so we declined. I might have reconsidered after spending two nights at this location. The rooms on the first floor are partially underground, so the windows are small. The draperies are nice, but block out more of the light, and they seem a little "cavish". The bathrooms, could not be more spectacular though and we always love the amenities: robes, slippers, high end soaps and lotions. Our first night, the thermostat in our room broke and we woke up at midnight in a sweat. We called the front desk and they sent someone down to fix things. For thirty minutes the staff were in our room with a ladder, crawling around the ceiling and fiddling with things. They fixed the air conditioning, and about an hour later around 1:00 a.m. our room had cooled off to the point we could fall asleep again. The next morning no mention was made of the incident, although in fairness the front desk did call us the next evening to ask about our room. The bed was ok, but not really special. No pillow top. No memory foam. No adjustable anything. It seemed like a standard, medium grade, king size mattress. Again, not bad, but not on par with previous experience at the Four Seasons (not extensive - we don't stay at the Four Seasons all the time). I informed the hotel ahead of time that we were traveling to Istanbul to celebrate our 10th anniversary, and I asked the hotel if they had recommendations for things I could do to mark the occasion. The concierge emailed me a list of recommended restaurants and other activities that was very helpful, although after I arrived the hotel made no mention of our anniversary. Again, I would never expect this from any other hotel, but prior experience has proven that the Four Seasons generally goes out of their way to "personalize" your experience. We weren't expecting them to give us anything, but I thought it would have been nice for the hotel to offer to make a reservation in their restaurant, offer us a time for a couple's massage at the spa, or included something in the personalized note in our room. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant, but breakfast both mornings was perfect! We went to the restaurant one evening for dessert and the attendant asked us if we could please sit in a lounge area outside the restaurant. Again, we didn't mind; the lounge area was very nice, but it just seemed like a lapse in attention to service that I found surprising. I suppose if I had insisted on being sat inside the restaurant they would have relented. If you stay here, you'll have a very nice stay. The location alone makes this hotel worth more. The staff were almost all incredibly polite and happy. We had a wonderful time. However, if you're expecting the over-the-top service and luxurious attention to detail that we have found at other Four Seasons properties, you may leave just a little... blah. I would not hesitate to stay at the Four Seasons Bosphorous hotel. I'm willing to give this hotel the benefit of the doubt. Based on the other reviews here, my experience was likely a fluke and maybe my expectations were too high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round with unbeatable personal service.”
Reviews.Author: dayfornight
Reviews.Content: Excellent all round. Great personal service from attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, EXCELLENT. Bravo !”
Reviews.Author: michele c
Reviews.Content: Exceeded high expectations. The staff, from first welcome to goodbye, were wonderful. The Four Seasons mantra of service exemplified by speed, quality and warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis of luxury and service. Restaurant was a bit pricey but the overall stay was 10/10”
Reviews.Author: peterjr66
Reviews.Content: A wonderful oasis of luxury and service. Location was excellent within easy reach of the city, restaurants and attractions. The hotel is not surrounded by any particularly noisy streets or neighbours and we enjoyed an excellent sleep. Staff service and facilities were excellent. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is outstanding particularly the staff.”
Reviews.Author: MBL1242
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived quite early and we were at the hotel before 8:00 am. They gave us the room immediately and we had tea, fruit and buscuits awaiting us. The staff was helpful, and just very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “More than five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roub
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Excellent location. Excellent room service. They provide us with free coffeemaker and coffee/tea each day (ask for it). Free complimentary fruit each day. Free internet. Walking distance to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Fritz21
Reviews.Content: This is what a Five-Star hotel should be. The decor is beautiful. The flowers add the finishing touches. We were always greeted with a warm friendly smile and hello from the entire staff. They went above and beyond for our six year old daughter. She felt like the Princess of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms have all the luxuries needed including a TV! I recommend a corner room overlooking the Aya Sofia. The location is walking distance to explore all the major sites. We hope to return to this wonderful hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Pair with Its Sister on the Bospheorus for a Fabulous Visit”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: The owners did a fabulous job redoing the old prison featured in Midnight Express and obviously excorcised any ghosts of its tortuous past. For my first few days of my first trip to Istanbul the location was perfect. Had a second floor room looking doqwn on Best Kebab whos friendly staff ke[pt chatting with us as wwe looked out the window. The room had huge and well appointed, and gave what I hoped to be a "turkish" flair to the comfort Four Seasons always provided. GReat location to visit Haga Sophia and environs. Great old streets to wander. Roof top bar a must to watch night all and feel the history. Their staff ferried us to the Bosphorus which gave us another side ot our most memorable. Istanbul experience

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: drjscharf
Reviews.Content: This is one first class hotel in the old city! The place is absolutely beautiful-actually a renovated prison. We were upgraded to the"warden's office" which was a spacious, two level suite with steam and all. The views from the rooftop are magnificent-Blue Mosque, etc. The restaurant breakfast buffet is great, The service is typical Four Seasons quality. The location is peaceful with lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: amw48
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with very attentive staff that anticipate and respond to your every need. We stayed for 2 nights and were so well looked after. The hotel is beautiful with the most amazing bathrooms. Our room 420 had a great view of the Hagia Sophia from the small balcony off the room. The food was great for breakfast - super yummy pastries, and the private tour of the old town that the hotel arranged through their partner travel agency was excellent (our tour guides name was Seda). A great experience at the 4 seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: michellejonas
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, we stayed a few night sin a suite there and left to tour other regions and returned for more time at the Sultanahmet. They not only gave us the same room both times, they had found a few forgoten articles and put them back in the room for us upon out second arrival (and washed and pressed my son's boxer shorts!) Fun neighborhood, really great hookah lounge down the street, great restaurants, walk to lots of cool stuff. Archeology Museum is the best, and it was empty when we went. I don't think this hotel had a pool, that would be ideal in the hot summer. Bur we went in November and it was just perfect weather, no crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Four Seasons with Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDowntown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jewel in the old city; small and intmate with only about sixty rooms, but each is unique and my room large, extremely well appointed, immaculate, with all the normal FS amenities. The staff is what really stands out at this location though; incredibly warm and engaging. This may be my favorite FS.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Max827
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days in November and were very happy. The hotel is an interesting and appealing building which I think would be even better in the summer with its huge inner courtyard and rooftop bars with splendid views. The staff are delightful, the restaurant is excellent and the room was very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast buffet, included in our rate, was superb. The hotel is perfectly situated for touring the Sultanahmet. Right next door is a fabulous newly-refurbished turkish bath which was a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A gem hidden away within a gem of a city....”
Reviews.Author: Tackos
Reviews.Content: We arranged to have a car from the hotel come pick us up. Which I strongly reccomend as firstly the airport is quite far away, and seemed very busy. Once we collected our luggage we were greeted by a member of the hotel, who was very polite and welcoming. Then put straight into a lovely BMW and driven to the hotel. Once we arrived, at what can be described as..... A gem. Your just blown away! Right in the heart of Istanbul lays this ancient prison, which is now our new home for the next 5 days! Greeted by the doorman and receptionist, we were taken to our room, which was again..... A gem, with a wonderful view! Welcome amenities, the lot! Upon waking up in our gem of a room, we followed down to breakfast, which is served in a lovely glassed restaurant, right in the middle of the hotel with the gardens all over.Â  The spa is small but nice. Spa treatments were as expected from a four seasons hotel.Â  Breakfast everyday was in their main restaurant, it's always a nice feeling to have recognition, same table of preference, they brought or offered our preferences, eg would you like to have your grapefruit juice today, or your Turkish coffee. Dinner in the main restaurant, again it was just lovely, I recommend the sole. Although I must admit, I would have liked more meat dishes. To sum up: I would strongly recommend this Four Seasons over the other one. The other one is bigger, but busier, out of town, and lacks.......charm. At the four seasons Sultanahmet you feel at home, a personal service, it's in the town centre. But what makes this place what it is, is the staff, from the welcome of the front door, to the room attendants. Conciege are extremely well knowledged on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: vzorrilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. Although we had high expectations of a Four Seasons and have stayed at a number of them, this one is smaller, relaxed, cozy, and has a fabulous staff. And the location and views are unique in Istambul. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond our wildest dream. Splurge, you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: TimothyOC
Reviews.Content: We selected the Four Seasons due to its reputation and we were not let down. This is truly a Luxury hotel in an amazing location. Nothing was less than perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!! Must saty here!”
Reviews.Author: Leticia H
Reviews.Content: Four seasons at Sultanahmet, Excellent location, SUPER CLEAN, very close to all attractions, walking distance to Grand Bazaar, Species Market, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Turkish Bath, Hippodrome, and many more ,,,local attractions! Excellent rooms, good food and great Staff, highly Recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tant00n
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most wonderful hotels I have ever stayed in. Upon arrival the staff was waiting for me, they were attentive and knew my name immediately. Every basic whim was met with a smile. The concierge knew the best places to dine, the front desk staff met every need with a smile and warmth that is amazing. The gym facilities were spectacular, water and local teas and coffees provided all day long. This is truly a magical hotel. They were doing some construction and the noise in the morning was bothersome, after calling the front desk the workers tried to limit the noise so that I could get some more sleep. The next day they were hammering again while I was enjoying the amazing bathtub in my beautiful bathroom, but I was too relaxed to complain again. Overall this hotel and the staff are superior.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful and memorable!”
Reviews.Author: nsl115
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable. The attention to detail by the housekeeping staff was outstanding! A mouse pad was placed under the mouse of my laptop. A bookmark was placed in my book. Delightful surprises! It was much appreciated that the GM sent a personal handwritten note and took the trouble to meet us. All the staff we met were warm, friendly and helpful...even at 5 am when we arrived! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel Istanbul at Sultanahmet is, without a doubt, the best Four Seasons and/or other 5-Star hotel we have ever stayed in and we have been staying in 5-Star hotels in Europe, Asia-Pacific and the US for over 30 years. The condition of the hotel (and our rooms), the staff, the facilities and the location were all perfect. Everything worked and worked seamlessly and nothing disappointed. There are still many places to go but we doubt we will stay in as delightful a hotel as this again - unless of course, we make a return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay and an experience os service”
Reviews.Author: DEPHUNT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and found is memorable. Service by all staff exceptional. We were 6 friends staying for new yeas eve and were totally spoilt. We were upgraded as part of American express package and the rooms were outstanding.briefest in the room fantastic with everything hot. Location again unbeatable and minutes from blur mosque and tapaki and loads of restaurants within10 minutes walk....really great position. Expensive but well worth the cost for city break and was memorable stay Only down side was the food in main restaurant which was not in our opinion good and let the hotel down but all the rest made up for that and many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NCABolter
Reviews.Content: Extraordinarily comfortable hotel with exceptionally helpful and polite staff. Location could not be better - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cisterns are all within 10 minute walk and Grand Bazaar only 10-15 minutes walk. There can be no better place for a weekend break. Wonderful view of Hagia Sophia from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: CA213
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic! In an old prison. Located right next to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Our first trip to Istanbul. We could not have imagined a better hotel experience. The hotel accommodations were great and the staff wonderful all around fron the front desk to the concierge everyone was exceptional. Truly a luxury experience. We will be back without question.

Reviews.Title: “The Sultan Ahmet Four Seasons hotel”
Reviews.Author: CairoDoudou
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I stayed many times and the staff never ceases to impress me. The rooms are lovely and the bathrooms are beautiful and spacious. The room service is excellent and the food at the restaurant menu is fresh and delicious. Concierge and reception are most helpful and courteous . I also had a massage this time that was out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Magic - - - Again!!”
Reviews.Author: mikeycee0630
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife on our anniversary at our favorite hotel. I know I wrote a review for this hotel seven months ago however I had to write another for our second stay at Sultanahmet. This hotel is definitely romantic & magical. I know we will be going back very soon so we can be treated properly. Staff is top-notch and the rooms are superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and Four Seasons service”
Reviews.Author: Barroba
Reviews.Content: Not only is it amazing to see the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque out of the window, but you are literally less than 2 minutes walking away from both those mosques, the Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, other museums and great restaurants. This is the "cultural" Four Seasons in Istanbul, the other one (@ The Bosphorus) is the more contemporary and due to its location, has a younger feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl8008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, as a Four Seasons should be. The staff was always friendly, welcoming, and helpful. I didn't really enjoy the area as much as I had hoped. Although it is right next to all the main attractions, it doesn't take that much to easily get there from other areas of the city. There is a street one block over from the hotel (I wish I would've remembered the name of it) that we dubbed "restaurant road of hell." I thought we were going to be attacked by all the men who were trying to get patrons into their restaurant. My advice would be to steer clear of this area. Find out where you're going to eat before you show up starving after a long international flight and then accidentally walk down this road! My only issue with the hotel is the concierge of course "recommends" the worst places. I know its because they get a kick-back from sending people to certain places. We wanted to experience a traditional Turkish Bath and they wanted to send us to the "newly renovated" one across the street from the hotel. We went to the Cagaloglu Hamami, which was 1/3 of the price and only about a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: As is typical of Four Seasons around the world, as soon as we arrived, we were informed that our room had been upgraded to a large suite, simply because it was available. Throughout the week, the staff was cheery and helpful, greeting us like honored diplomats rather than tourists, and happy to accomodate even the smallest request. The hotel is old, but updated and decorated beautifully, and situated perfectly about a 2 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive professional service with lots of smiles, and nothing was too difficult.”
Reviews.Author: pgdavo
Reviews.Content: The standout was the super comfy bed and fabulous pillows. It was quiet and luxurious. Breakfast was good. We preferred a la carte at both breakfast and the Sunday brunch. Was surprised that Istanbul taxi drivers really didn't know the hotel at all. It might be easier to direct the driver to Aya Sofya and take the minute walk down the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Classic style”
Reviews.Author: vanderhof
Reviews.Content: Created from an old prison and dopne to a very high degree of old fashioned luxury-warmer than the other Four Seasons in Istanbul but with the same abundance of orchids everywhere A choice location in the old section so walking to historic sites is wonderful.....Grand Bazaar only 20 minutes away Exellent restaurant in a glass gazebo with piano music at night; good service and spectacular desserts Rooms looking into the courtyard are nice but third floor rooms overlooking the excavations are more interesting. Generous baths and lovely L'Occitane toiletries High speed internet but not free

Reviews.Title: “location and hotel were incredible”
Reviews.Author: eat_drink_and_sleep
Reviews.Content: the hotel has so much history and character in the building itself, but its location can't be beat. It is literally steps away from the main touristy areas in Istanbul. I would recommend to anyone, it was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Four nights of heaven...”
Reviews.Author: Vasdoc
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful few days in this hotel and wanted to move in. The room was gorgeous, the staff amazing, attentive, and genuine in their interest, and whole feeling of how they manage the hotel perfect. yes, it is expensive, but with a two minute walk to the Blue Mosque, the cisterns, and a ten minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and the comfort of such a wonderful hotel, I think a bargain. We had stayed in the Ciragan Palace 10 years ago, were happy, but this excelled. My wife and I loved this experience, and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Marmee14
Reviews.Content: Had a too short stay at this hotel prior to embarking on an Aegean cruise. The location is within walking distance to many important attractions and wonderful for just walking around and taking in the ambience. The room was beautifully appointed and the staff were all friendly and helpful. Lovely shops nearby. If I return to Istanbul I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the Best Four Seasons Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed S
Reviews.Content: Please I would like to thank each member of your perfect staff. Actually this is my best stay at any Four Seasons hotel. Thank you from my heart for making our stay super perfect and I will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Jessie D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my favorite in the whole world based on its location, wonderful architecture and intimate size.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, fantastic location, style and history and a staff that cant do enough for you”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: The intro says it all but this hotel sets a very high standard. Built in what for many years a prison, this is true luxury and grace. Far from its prison incarnation although you can still see the carvings in the stone of past guests. The rooms are fantastic and either good views of the red masque or the very lavish and well done court yard. I assume it used to be an exercise yard for the prisoners. The restaurant is top notch and the buffet breakfast would put most Sunday lavish brunches to shame. The location in the mist of the old city right between the red and blue mosques is ideal. Having said all that, the best part is the staff who cannot do enough to assure a fantastic stay. Visit Istanbul you will be blown away by the city, its culture and its people. And stay here. Any other place would be a missed opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineTC
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons is in the Old City/Historical area of Istanbul. It has been converted from the centuries old Sultanahmet Prison and includes the watch tower. There are only 65 rooms configured in a square shape with wonderful gardens and restaurant in the center courtyard. It is literally steps from all important historical sites. With only 65 rooms, and Dec was a quieter month, the service was absolutely exquisite and individualized. We enjoyed a short walk to Istanbul Transit. We did visit the other Four Seasons in the newer city and while it was beautiful, we much preferred our historical hotel with its welcoming yellow walls and old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: jenskar
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure how they did it, but the color of the walls at this perfectly located hotel is so soothing, you feel as if someone is massaging your syche through your eyes. Sultanahmet for the first time visitor can be visually overwhelming -- the patterns of Iznik tile work at the Blue Mosque, the exquisite mosaics of Agia Sofia, the myriad carpet shops, the cacophony goods available at the Grand Bazaar. The Four Seasons is at once serene and centrally located, a tough act for any hotel to master. I would recommend staying here to anyone who is experiencing Istanbul for the first time; you're steps away from so many things you want to see and hardly have to think about how to get to all the major sites; they're there as soon as you fall out of bed in the morning. That is, if you can tear yourself away from the breakfast buffet. One of my favorite hotels in the world, and you can see why it wins all those awards! It deserves them!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: mckall_s_a
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is a beautiful hotel and very luxurious. The staff is extremely friendly and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury/service where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: Murphles
Reviews.Content: We spent four days here and were delighted. It is in the "old town", so walkable to many major sites and attractions (we had no need/desire to be in the "Fifth Avenue" ritzy westernized part of town) and with lots of cheap local eateries. Beautifully-done conversion of an old prison, so lots of character without loss of amenities. And the service was superb -- NOTHING was beyond the attention or help of the staff. Best breakfast buffet of our three weeks in Turkey, plus a top restaurant in-house for a splurge. A bit distant from some of the tourist attractions/museums, but taxis were plentiful and cheap. Highly recommend the experience and the property...it has soul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful area of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Fabiolaabu
Reviews.Content: Showed up to a friendly greeting. Were shown up to our rooms very quickly. They knew it was my birthday-sent a cake up within a few hours of arrival. Only one bottle of water was given with the room-we asked if it was ok to drink from the tap, instead they sent us 10 bottles to be sure we weren't thirsty. Great staff, great location, beautiful bar and nice restaurant.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Confort and Peace in the heart of Istambul”
Reviews.Author: PatCosta
Reviews.Content: if you want to be treated as royalty you should go to Four Seasons at Sultanahmet! The most kind people and a flawless service of all. The hotel is not too small and not so big, and the location is perfect to someone who wants to walk to the bazaars and wonder by night safely. Me and my husband had a wonderfull time there, we surely recommended it! ps: For someone like me who love sweets, discovering the turkish delight was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven in Istanbul; the best Four Seasons I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherChicago
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, this is a high-quality hotel. There was no request too mundane or odd, and the staff was consistently friendly and helpful. The concierge was particularly helpful in arranging a lot of dinner reservations and car services to/from IST airport and around town. The location cannot be beat, and the inner courtyard and the rooftop terraces with views of the Bosphorus are wonderful places to relax. Yes, it's expensive, but yes, it's worth it. Room 315 is the best in the hotel, with a private small balcony overlooking the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location that complet the experience!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPuggy
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Sultanahmet is the place to be in Istanbul especially when you have to stay here for longer than a couple of days. Location in Istanbul is unbeatable. Attentive and detail oriented staff and management left us a very strong impression of this hotel. We were greeted with smiles right at the very first step to the moment you turned around the corner of the street leaving the hotel. You were addressed by our names at all times. Food was a delightful and reasonable prices for its class. Never realized that lamb can be done and presented in such a way that it looked more like a piece of dessert! It was our residence of choice during our stay in Istanbul while we were also popping in and out as we were also taking short trips to Cappadoica and Pamukale. Each time we wwnt back to this hotel, we felt relieved knowing that we would go back to a very comfortable place to rest and relax. Basically, at the end of each short trip away from Istanbul we were looking forward to going back to Four Seasons Sultanahmet. We had three different rooms. We were absolutely satisfied with anyone of them and all of them. Four Seasons is always our first choice of accommodation around the world such as Singapore, Japan, Maldives, Paris, Hong Kong, etc. I can't say all of them we'd been to are as good as our experience at this Four Seasons Sultanahmet. We do have a preference of contemporary design interior so our absolute favorite of Four Seasons is Four Seasons Marunochi in Tokyo, Japan where we stayed twice. This Four Seasons Sultanahmet is among the top three hotels of all the hotels we have stayed before over hundreds of cities we'd been to in terms of location, hardware and software. For sure, it is one of those that we will go back for our next visit in Istanbul. I can never rate excellent for sleep quality as it will only be for my bed at home! Average in value to me means it's right at its price range for its quality.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi75
Reviews.Content: Having read the stories about taxi drivers in Istanbul, we decided to stay at the Four Seasons at the Sultanahmet. The location is perfect, we were able to walk to all the main sites from our hotel. Istanbul is amazing â€“ very clean, and you feel completely safe. We booked the airport transfer through the hotel and this worked exceptionally well. Our room had a lovely view of the Sea of Marmara and out one side you could catch a view of Haghia Sofia as well. The rooms are spacious and very tastefully decorated. We used the Concierge service to book our private guide and this worked well â€“ we had the same guide for both days. The food was the letdown here, more particularly breakfast â€“ where the hot food was actually lukewarm. When we pointed this out it was addressed promptly by the staff, unfortunately too late for us as we had a tour guide to meet. The history of the hotel as a former prison, adds to the character. The beds are very comfortable. Donâ€™t miss the Suleymaniye Mosque - itâ€™s about a 20 minutes walk from the hotel. A beautiful mosque, and a lot more peaceful than the crowded Blue Mosque. We were moving to the Four Seasons at the Bosphorus next so the hotel organised a complimentary transfer in a BMW 7 series.

Reviews.Title: “A sultans delight!”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: This is the best old town hotel experience. The standards are of the typical Four Seasons caliber, which practically defy decription but mean "superlative" in any language, but equally important is the location. You can walk to all of the old town attractions and there is a marvelous neighborhood souk right around the corner! This hotel is the jam!

Reviews.Title: “Six Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and location; walking distance to all the major sites-Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market . I love the history of this Four Seasons. The staff was always very helpful and courteous. The concierges make some wonderful recommendation. Be sure to visit the Ayasofya Turkish Baths close by the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre rooms for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: Despite the flawless Four Seasons service, we found our standard room to be entirely unspectacular, particularly given (1) the price premium vs. other luxury lodging options in Istanbul and (2) when compared to all other Four Seasons we have stayed at. Perhaps it's a new build vs. renovation of historic-building-that-was-not-originally-a-hotel thing.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace and beauty in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Nickyhomoeopath
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Sultanahmet exceeded all expectations. Perfect location, beautiful rooms and bathrooms, gracious staff. We were a party of five celebrating a 50th Birthday. The main celebratory night was held on the roof and was truly a night to remember. Our only minor complaint was that the rest of the guests seemed to retire very early, so when we decided to pay a late night trip to the bar (11.45pm) we found it deserted (of guests and staff).

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: johnanthonycooper
Reviews.Content: A very good experience of good hotel and service levels for a 3 day tourist break in Istanbul. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Wedding...”
Reviews.Author: bizliketraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our wedding in Istanbul. We were hoping for a great experience given the importance of the occasion. Given this was a storied Four Seasons, our expectations were already set pretty high... unfairly so. Nevertheless, the hotel staff blew us away. I have never experienced such hospitality and attention to every detail. Truly incredible... this is to say nothing of the view we had of the Blue Mosque to the left and the Hagia Sophia to the right off our our balcony. It was amazing... I can not say enough nice things about the hotel, the location or the staff. World Class.

Reviews.Title: “First rate- a beautiful and cultural experience!”
Reviews.Author: keentraveler30
Reviews.Content: There is nothing more I can say about this property, except everything about it is first rate, hands down superior! It is located in the museum/historical sights area, so everything is at your fingertips for culture lovers. The property itself is a converted jail, which in my opinion, is a cultural experience in and of itself. The hotel staff-I couldn't say more regarding the friendliness, helpfulness, and first rate service! The restaurant is also lovely and delicious- The director of rooms, Erhan, is a Turkish Aussie; extremely helpful and friendly-I also received an upgrade, and had a beautiful room with a balcony and view of the AiyaSofia. I only wish I had more time to enjoy it, as I was running around trying to absorb the loveliness and culture of Istanbul. I couldn't have had a better stay or a more excellent and enjoyable experience! The gym/spa were also very useful/comforting and first rate, although the Bosphorus property is unmatchable. All around, an excellent experience, just too short!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emaock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011, walked to every major site . . . Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar. This was an old jail and it's been refurbished beautifully. The staff was incredibly helpful and soooo nice! Food in the restaurant was above average, good for breakfast mainly, but the hotel is around the corner from a street filled with lots of restaurants . . . get a recommendation from the hotel on the best. Go to the Aya Sofia Turkish Bath another recommendation from the hotel . . . it was amazing and again around the corner, literally. Loved our stay at this hotel in Istanbul, much better location than the Four Seasons Bosphorus, I would recommend staying in the old city NOT on the Bosphorus side, the traffic is horrific, worse than any I've seen in the US. You'd always need a cab ride across the Galata Bridge to get to the main sights from a Bosphorus hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: chevydallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons for three nights,sept9to the 11th. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. We only stay in 5 star hotels. This hotel really exceeded our expectations. It is new and the details in the rooms are really well thought out. The room was huge and really quite overlooking the courtyard. The espresso machine in the room got a work out. The fitness room was fine. The staff was genuine and truly desired to help and insure we had a great experience. The location of the hotel in the old part of town is walking distance to mayor attractions, but we recommend one of the guide services such as Sea Song because it is half the price of any in Europe and the guides and vans were terrific. The breakfast Buffett is truly one of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rkjlondon
Reviews.Content: Great location for many of the attractions and it's Four Seasons...need I say more.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: maria c
Reviews.Content: Excellent, confortable, good staff , good breakfast , perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for TOP TOP Price”
Reviews.Author: rachiefish
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights here and were somewhat disappointed, given that this is a VERY expensive hotel. To be clear, my criticism isn't really about the hotel per se--it's more about the relative luxury (or lack thereof) in light of the price (around $700USD). The hotel is very well-located for sight-seeing, especially if you have limited time in Istanbul--all of the major sites are within 5-10 minutes walking distance. The hotel is pretty and the service is what you would expect from a Four Seasons--we were pleased with the two restaurants that they recommended for dinner. We ate breakfast and one lunch at the hotel restaurant and both were quite good. The room, however, was clean but not at all memorable. It was very hot, but the A/C never got quite cool enough. Our room was on the ground floor and thus had no view and was fairly dark. The decor wasn't offensive, but again, was not memorable. Overall, for the amount of money we spent, I felt that the hotel was VERY overpriced. We had a drink at the Four Seasons on the Bosophorous, which was much prettier. I suspect that the Bosphorous location would come closer to being worth the price. If you're not made of money and expect special/luxurious accomodations when you're paying for, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the midst of tourists and hawkers.”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyMM
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second trip to Istanbul. After previously staying in the Taksim area we wanted to stay in the older part and enjoy the Tultanahmet area. The Four Seasons is convenient to every attraction and walking distance to most everything. It's small and intimate and the services, staff and attention to detail that we have come to expect from the Four Seasons did not disappoint. After walking the busy streets and sites, we found that returning to our hotel was like returning to an oasis in the midst of tourists of street hawkers. We treated ourselves to a leisurely and delicious breakfast every morning and enjoyed the courtyard and visiting with our friendly and interesting waitstaff. The "Signature Sultanahmet Massage" is not to be missed! The Four Seasons helped make our trip a delight!

Reviews.Title: “best service”
Reviews.Author: jjjaaa_10
Reviews.Content: ultra qualified and friendly staff, in the best location in Istambul...you can walk in few minutes to the Haghia Sofia, the blue Mosque or the Topkapi Palace, even the famous water cistern! comes at a price, though....

Reviews.Title: “excellent service - in my time of need.”
Reviews.Author: daniyah
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Istanbul for her first visit there, and she tipped into heart failure the morning after we landed - just outside the hotel. The staff rushed her to the nearest hospital, in the General Managers own car, and stayed with me at the hospital interpreting and helping me arrange her treatment. They saved her life! The hotel was there for me through the whole trip, advising, offering top class assistance and managed the whole ordeal in an empathetic, caring and truly 5 star manner. The food was excellent, the staff unbelievable and the support they offered me far surpassed my expectations. I will no doubt visit again with my mother when she is better, and can recommend this hotel to anyone visiting istanbul for the first time. It is close to the main historical sites, and there are many places to eat within walking distance. Do visit!

Reviews.Title: “Just one word... is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: delicatny_macho
Reviews.Content: I have no words to describe our impressions about the hotel. Maybe just one word... is perfect! The hotel is located (as you have guessed) at Sultanahmet, where you can dive in the atmosphere of old Istanbul, just in 2 minutes from Aigha Sophia and Topkapi. The hotel staff is an example to follow - friendly, effective, professional. It was our first stay at Istanbul and at Four Seasons Hotel chain at all, but we've got room upgrade on arrival. The room we've got was excellent. So, the staff tries to use any opportunities to satisfy the clients. You can ask me - Is it pricey? No, it is not pricey - I'll answer to you. It is insanely expensive! But if you would like to know what does it mean "perfect", you would spend some money to stay at Four Seasons Hotel Istanbul at Sultanahmet at least for two or three days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel ,we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: theIlovetravelbird
Reviews.Content: Service exemplary just as you would expect from a Four Seasons. Beautiful room overlooking courtyard Really enjoyed the heritage of the building Good location

Reviews.Title: “trip of a life time”
Reviews.Author: tamiraesong
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little hotel, the smallest Four Seasons I have stayed in. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The location is perfect in seeing the most important sightseeing locations. Great attention to detail and always able to fill special requests. We called the front desk to ask where we could get a contact lens case and they went out, found one, and delivered it to us within 20 minutes. Also when the manager of the room service found out it was our last day, he personally brought up a plate of Turkish delights for us to take home.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay in the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LadyBKent_UK
Reviews.Content: A Four Season hotel never fails to deliver and this is no exception. Absolutely first class in everything. Staff highly professional and very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was superb.This is a great location for a city break situated in the old city where you can walk to all the main attractions (Blue Mosque etc). There are plenty of good restaurants and shops very close to the hotel to wander around.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: MMPJ1956
Reviews.Content: Our room was of international moderate to high class. Our view was onto excavations - quite interesting but not scenic. The food as good as one can expect at this type of place in Turkey. Location good for walking tour of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in every way. Many very good restaurants within walking distance - no need to go elsewhere and spend too much time in the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to spend a night in "prison"...(former prison!)”
Reviews.Author: LAMERSFBAYAREA
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable time at this hotel. The hotel has taken the old prison and totally transformed it into a luxury hotel! (Watch "Midnight Express - a 1970s movie about the former prison...) The location is perfect for sight-seeing in Istanbul. I would return...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic and exceptional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MSW0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the service is outstanding. The location is perfect for visiting the most important sites in Istanbul. Very convenient for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel withing walking distance of some of the most popular historical sites in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel conveniently located. Rooms, food, service, decor all make us want to return. Would definitely pick this hotel for our next stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AP_JLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I here for 4 nights. The hotel was the old prison and has been very well converted. We had a room on the top floor with a balcony and views to the see and Mosque. Though it was nice to have the balcony and the fact it was in the eves possibly made the room look smaller than it was as the ceilings were not as high as they would have been on another floor. As one would expect from a Four Season's hotel the service was impeccable and the staff were very professional. We enjoyed numerous drinks at the bar lounge. Drinks came with an abundance of nuts and snacks which were delicious and replenished. Breakfast was plentiful and located in a conservatory type dinning area looking out to the gardens making it a very peaceful experience. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant as there were so many nice places we had spotted outside the hotel we wanted to try. The hotel offered complimentary tea or ' lemon' flavoured water at the entrance which was very refreshing on our return after a busy day sightseeing. The location is excellent for all the sights and there are plenty of eating places on the roads to the right of the hotel. Other than the usual sights we would definitely recommend the Basilica Cistern - very impressive and if you like Baklavas a trip to Cigdem Pastanesi and if you like fish a fresh fish sandwich from a boat just by the Galata bridge. Basically eat eat and eat - food is just delicious !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for honeymooners and sightseers”
Reviews.Author: readyfortheweekend
Reviews.Content: It's the Four Seasons, so I expected quality in product and service, and I was not disappointed. The hotel was a stones throw away from the Blue Mosque and other major tourist attractions. It was a pleasure coming back to the comforts of our room after a long day of walking. If we had more time, I would've spent more time enjoying the hotel's amenitities. We didn't make it to the restaurant or up to the roof. The concierges were extremely helpful as were the bellmen. I jokingly wrote on the feedback sheet that I was aghast that I had to open the front door for myself three times. We stayed there three nights, so of course I was joking. There was always an employee around to greet us, tell us good night, and generally make us feel welcome. A couple things to keep in mind when booking this Four Seasons as opposed to the one on the Bosphorous. The spa is much smaller and lacks the same services offered at the Bosphorous location. We had an early flight into Istanbul, so we arrived at the hotel much earlier than check-in. Our room wasn't ready, so they gave us a list of things we could do, one of them being a service in the spa at a discount. After spending two full days walking around in Athens, I was dying for a mani/pedi. Unfortunately, we were told that this location didn't offer that service. The Bosphorous is about a 20 minute cab drive, which after a morning full of travelling, the last thing we wanted to do was hop in a cab and drive across town. We left Athens during the taxi strike, and had an early flight to Istanbul, so we had to take the first train to the airport from our Athens hotel. Needless to say, we were extremely tired when we got to the hotel. They did refer us to a closer nail salon, but couldn't guaruntee the cleanliness of the service, so I passed, and after taking an extra long lunch, we just loitered in the business center until our room was ready. Also, they told us they would call us if the room was ready early, which it was. However, my husband had to go the front desk and inquire about the status for them to tell us the room was ready. Finally, this was the only hotel during our whole trip where we had to pay for internet access. With the amount we paid nightly to stay here, the very least they could do is offer free wifi. We once stayed at a cheap Extended Stay after a flood in our home, and even they offered free wifi. Even the cafes nearby offered free wifi. It seems ridicoulous that we spent close to $50 for three days of wifi. Those were my only issues with our stay. In the grand scheme of things, they seem small. However, after weeks of travelling, it's nice to have those things available to you when needed. Istanbul is so big, and there are so many things to do, that I feel like we didn't even tap the service. If and when we come back, I think I would stay here again. Hopefully they'll rethink their wifi policy by then.

Reviews.Title: “Initimate hotel, unbelieveable location, fantastic service....great for families”
Reviews.Author: tuckie
Reviews.Content: Hard to add tot he superlatives that this property has earned but we had a fantastic time at the Four Seasons....it was an interesting contrast to time spent later in our trip at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul. Firstly, as others have said the location was just phenomenal. We had two rooms on the fourth floor, both with terraces on opposite sides of a hallway. Although the doors were literally across the hall from one another the two views couldn't have been more different. One terrace had a spectacular view of the Hagia Sophia the other of the Blue Mosque. Being able to see these buildings so close at various times of the day (sunrise, evening, etc.) was a treat. The staff at the Four Seasons were amazing. I still have no idea how the remember the name of every guest but being greeted by name enhanced the intimate feel of the property. Service was impeccable at the restaurant and the spa. Our children were delighted that the hotel greeted them with a number of gifts laid out in their room upon arrival....a Turkey t-shirt, puzzles, local souvenirs. Although there isn't a proper spa at the hotel we did enjoy the signature massage.....a great way to relax after a long trip. If you do stay here you really should go to Ayasofya Haman....it's just been renovated and is the most luxurious haman in Istanbul....and it is literally 50 yards from the hotel. We were a bit apprehensive about going at first because we had no idea what to expect but the experience was extraordinary. Men and women have different entrances and completely different (but comparable) facilities. We selected the VIP treatment which included the traditional bath, soap massage, mud bath and oil massage. The experience felt other-worldly and helped connect to the Turkish culture. There was a point where I was sitting in this amazing marble bath hall all alone, sitting on a steaming marble bench with a platter of fresh fruit in front of me....and your realize how the sultans must have lived. You are assigned your own masseuse who walks you through every step of the 2-hour process which makes the experience very comfortable. In any event this is a special hotel that shouldn't be missed. We've stayed at many Four Seasons properties and this was one of our favorites because it incorporates so much of the character and personality of it's local environment....in the architecture, the service, the cuisine, the people....just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great staff great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kickstart1
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and staff.... Best spa.... One of the top in the world... Right in the middle of many historic places in Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: atw100
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has charm and has an ideal location for sightseeing. This was our fourth stay at this hotel and we've stayed at more than a dozen other Four Seasons hotels. We unfortunately had numerous mix-ups with our reservations this time, including when they were allegedly inexpicably cancelled by an unknown person under mysterious circumstances (not by us). I discovered this only when reconfirming shortly before arrival. It was very difficult to get our original rate reinstated, but the hotel ultimately took care of it. Also, we booked and paid for a deluxe room and were clearly not given a deluxe room but instead a small room looking right out onto the sidewalk with bathroom pocket doors that had a deliberate and awkward 2 inch gap between them. This meant the bathroom door could never be fully closed. The room was not up to Four Seasons standards, although we have had much nicer rooms at this hotel before. The breakfast buffet is fairl good, but nothing special and quite expensive. The cocktails on the rooftop deck (a place with spectacular views) are stunningly expensive but mostly creative, interesting and delicious. Internet access is also extremely expensive. Overall, the hotel is worth the price only if money is no object and proximity to Old City tourist sites is the most important consideraton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannmike
Reviews.Content: This is the very best. Beautiful hotel within walking distance to the sights in Sultanahmet. Excellent accommodations, food and outstanding friendly service. You cant go wrong staying here. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Intensely intimate, personal and ultimately satisfying experience.”
Reviews.Author: teaearlgreyhot
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel with a relatively small number of rooms, and incredibly intimate service. Everywhere one went, we would be greeted and asked about our days. On our arrival, the manager himself showed him to our room, one of the smallest but my goodness one would find suites that are smaller at some other five star chains. Turndown service was done every evening and extremely great amounts of attention to detail was placed on making sure things were done correctly. This gushing is tempered by only two criticisms: if one can call it that. 1) There aren't that many facilities available here, only 1 restaurant, (of a great standard), and no pool or such facilities one usually finds in 5* hotels. But given one's location, literally right in the middle of Sultanahmet and the Hagia Sofia, you will not need to spend too long in one's room. And 2) all this intimacy and personalisation comes at a cost. Which unfortunately, one would expect. All in all, I could not recommend this place enough, IF you have the resources to spend a few days here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 255103Robert
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a great location in the old part of the city. The staff a great and nothing is an issue for them.My wife and i were both sick and the staff organise a doctor who gave us medication and also advise the staff on what we should eat it that they prepared for us. The Hotel is amazing and i rate it highly

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sarah-rostro
Reviews.Content: Four seasons hotel was a great place to stay, beautiful views, lovely atmosphere and helpful staff. Situated close to resturants and a short walk to the most amazing sites in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a bustling but wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie055
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a wonderful week at the Four Seasons , Sultanahmet and have nothing but praise for the hotel and staff. The hotel is centrally located in the old city and is in walking distance to the hippodrome, blue mosque, Aya Sofya, the Topkapi Palace etc. The hotel itself is a wonderful place to come back to at the end of a long day of sightseeing with the rooftop bar overlooking the city the main highlight. The view from our window was a bit disappointing as it basically looked out onto a construction site, but it is not active, and when we found out that it is an excavation site for Roman and Greek ruins we felt a bit better. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed and the staff are fantastic. Check in and check out were quick and efficient and the staff in every part of the hotel could not have been friendlier. Special thanks must go to Mustafa who has the job of meeting guests at the airport and then making sure that they are safely checked onto their flights at the end of their stay. We had a major problem when checking in as our confirmation number was lost. Mustafa led us through a complicated process of fixing the problem. He displayed patience and appropriate assertiveness as he worked with the airlines staff and us, and stayed with us for the hour it took to sort out the problem. The hotel is a class act.

Reviews.Title: “What a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fizam
Reviews.Content: Though the Four Seasons Sultanahmet is extremely expensive and in some ways a little overpriced, it is a beautiful hotel that is not your "run of the mill" normal hotel. The building is old and set in a fantastic part of Istanbul with lots of wonderful little restaurants near by. The service is first class, so if you don't mind paying a little extra you will get a hotel that is very different, within walking distance to some of the major sites of this interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing expirience!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmkraw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent tourist location. Absolutely comfortable and interesting interiors and wonderful service! Recommend to everyone who wants to stay in interesting, but comfortable at the same time place. Close (walking distance) to major sights. Food also great, but could be a little more local.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: nikosstephanietasos
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was amazing and made our stay enjoyable and easy. This is one of the best services we experienced in any hotel that we have visited on this earth in the last 10 years. The condition of the hotel was great, also. For people interested in visiting the old town and the historic monuments, the location of this hotel is great; less than few minutesâ€™ walk from TopKapi, AyaSofia etc. On the top of the building there is a bar with great views of AyaSofia and the Sea of marmara. We highly recommend staying at this great place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, great old city location!”
Reviews.Author: danixnyc
Reviews.Content: We went after Christmas and stayed for 5 nights. Great old city location, amazing service and staff. The room was lovely and with a great view over the mosque and Topkapi. Watched the fireworks from our terrace. Our flight was delayed and the driver the hotel sent was professional and courteous at 2AM. The food was excellent. The location is perfect for the old city, but a bit far from the other side specially since Istanbul traffic is horrible. Next time I would do 2 days at this one and 2 days at the Four Seasons at the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: leloir
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay in Istanbul if you are a tourist. It has an extraordinary location in the middle of all the old sites. Much more convenient than 4 Seasons location on the Bosphorous, which is far from the tourist sites and is more convention hotel than small luxury hotel.
