This 4 Seasons has it all: Impeccable service. Elegant public rooms and rooftop terrace. Impeccable service. We loved our room (304), which had a view of the Blue Mosque from the tub. If you can afford it, treat yourself. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a very comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ollivant
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with top quality service. The location is great and perfect for visiting the centre of old Constantinople.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely adored this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfmclaire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely lovely inside and out. I had to work in my room in the evening but the decor and feel of the hotel was so perfect I felt that I was enjoying Istanbul even though I was stuck in my hotel room. The service is helpful and friendly. The views amazing from the fourth floor terrace. And the hotel could not be better situated for visiting Istanbul. I can not say enough nice things about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Perfect Location and Setting”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay while in Istanbul. The location in the old town is perfect. A few minutes walk to most important sites. Many great places to shop or eat withing walking distance as well. I also loved the fact that unlike most Four Seasons, this is a smaller hotel with a more personal and cozy feel to it. Only 2 or 3 stories high with a small, beautifully landscaped courtyard. The rooms are fairly spacious and very comfortable. The staff are all professional and helpful. The only down fall is the restaurant. While the breakfasts were great, we did not care for the dinner we had on our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm in Center of Busy City”
Reviews.Author: JMBPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at this hotel before heading out on a Greek island cruise. The location cannot be beat. The Blue Mosque, The Palace Cistern, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace all within 5-10 minutes walk from hotel. Four seasons quality from greeting to departure. Rooms spacious and clean. Very pleasant rooftop terrace with amazing views of Hajia Sofia and Blue Mosque. Had breakfast and lunch at the restaurant which is located in an inner courtyard with lovely tropical plants. Cannot hear city noises at all in courtyard. Public rooms bright and tastefully decorated and never felt overcrowded. One day, I foolishly left our safe open all day while we went on a walking tour. There was cash, jewelry and other valuables there for the taking. When we returned, nothing had been touched. Perhaps we just got lucky but the room had been serviced in our absence. A small gripe for the sake of balance. The concierges, although very friendly and helpful, had the slightly annoying tendency of recommending very expensive, glitzy and not necessarily authentic dining venues. One sees this at most high end hotels as this is what mauch of thier clientel probably expects. While on the subject of restaurants, please go to Restaurant Aloran. Take a left upon exiting the Four Seasons and take another left at the next corner. It's about 50 yards along the street an a corner on the right hand side. It is my intention to review Aloran soon but suffice it to say, I highly recommend it. The concierge had never heard of it! A great travel memory for me will be waking to the call to prayer as I gaze at Hajia Sofia through the morning mist. As you might expect, this place is not inexpensive but, in mu view. very much worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: edward02494
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons looked in Sultanahmat is in a great location & easy walk to a lot of attractions & 5 minutes to the tram which is easy to navigate. Altho expensive, the quiet elegance is worth the price. The room was large, small suite, with excellant bed & bedding. Everyone in hotel greeted you where ever you were & many surprised me by knowing our name. The rooms were very quiet. Bathroom was large with a waterfall showerhead from 8 feet high. Breakfast buffet was like most Four Seasons. Dinner in a courtyard enclosed glass room was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely”
Reviews.Author: mikeycee0630
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I were treated like royalty!!! The staff was very helpful and kind - always smiling!! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fatanstic stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: hotelsetc
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Istanbul was a surprise birthday treat for my husband having always had the city on his 'wish' list. Emails confirming arrangements between myself and the hotel were both answered promptly and curtiously which paved the way for a most fabulous 2 night stay. We were given room 305 which had been the prison wardens apartment, now it is a sumptious suite with a ground floor sitting, dining and desk area. The stairs led us up to our mezzanine bedroom with the largest bathroom we have every seen, even the shower doubled up as a steam cubicle..... As hard as it was to leave the room, we ventured out and very quickly realised that the hotel is in a perfect location for all the main sights. Yes, you are asked continuously if you would like to visit a carpet shop but a firm polite smiley "no thank you" worked fine. On our return the hotel had placed in our room an amazing birthday cake for my husband. We decided to eat in one of the local fish restaurants and were recommended one by concierge, about 5 mins walk away. This turned out to be packed inside and outside (popular choice) so the reservation made on our behalf was a very good idea! Food and ambience top notch. Before arriving we had booked through the hotel a days guide. We asked for recommended Seda, who was interesting, well read and had a delightful personality. Visiting major sights, the bazaar and spice market made for a perfect day under Seda's expert guidance. We have stayed at some top hotels but the breakfast in the courtyard was one of the best we had experienced. Reluctantly, we left after two nights with a complimentary transfer to the FS on the Bosphorus. The hotel with its location, beautiful rooms and some of the nicest staff we have ever encounted at a hotel made for a most perfect birthday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Irene060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of the Sultanahmet. Superb staff, incredibly helpful and I would recommend everyone stay here if they felt their budget stretched to it. I always say Four Seasons have the best hotel beds!

Reviews.Title: “Usual four seaons excellent quality”
Reviews.Author: SimLucas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons in Istanbul for three nights and found everything to be the usual Four Seasons exceptional standard. The room was spacious and comfortable, with lots of added extras such as DVD player with list of movies, a gorgeous spa bath with TV and nice touches such as fresh fruit and turkish delight delivered daily to the room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and recommended restaurants and organised a private tour for us as well (which was excellent). The breakfast was extensive and delicious and we also ate in the restaurant in the hotel one night which was really nice as well. The only downside of the whole experience was the hotel charging 20 euros for wireless internet in the rooms, which seems excessive considering a lot of other places offer it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ryan.W
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt the concierge staff at this hotel is among the best. Get to know them fast and use their expert advice and recommendations. Their help is essential for the first time tourist. Special thanks to all for the private tour of the old city highlights. Ask for Seda Karaca from Travelium. She was warm, friendly, humorous, and informative. I have never had a better tour guide; and was elated to skip to the front of the line at all attractions. The hotel is architecturally significant with elegant decor and rooms with jaw-dropping views. Housekeeping and front desk staff exceptional. But.....avoid the restaurant and room-service as it was mediocre food at best; but with friendly service. Instead use the concierge for recommendations on many authentic dining experiences within steps of the hotel. As well, the spa is NOT a spa. It is two lockerooms, two massage rooms and a cramped fitness room that doubles as the spa reception area. And all contained in a not to comfortable subterranean setting. No one was there to greet us so we made do on our own. The hotel massage was no where near the best I've had. Instead go to the local Turkish hamam for an authentic experience. Lastly, the airport transportation, although comfortable, is not operated by the FS and therefore lackluster in its service. On neither journey to/from the airport would the driver speak to us even though they clearly spoke English. That was a huge disappointment. First impressions are important and a welcome to our city would have been nice. So it was an almost perfect stay with some hiccups along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: chestpain
Reviews.Content: This is the largest hotel room I have ever seen in Europe that is not a suite. The bathroom is beautiful with a separate bath tub and shower. Electric window blinds. The most attentive staff who knew me by name. Treats every night when we returned from touring. Welcoming gifts for the kids. A view of the Sea of Marmara in one window with the Hagia Sophia in the other. Five minutes from the Hippodrome/Blue Mosque/Hagia Sofia/Basilical Cistern. Delicious breakfast buffett that was difficult to leave before touring (chocholate croissants that were sinful). Hot cherry tea ready in the lobby when returning from touring in the cold day. The best dinners with authentic Turkish food. My wife wanted a message when we returned from our tour. Within 15 minutes notice, they were ready for her. No, I don't work for the hotel. Yes, it is expensive but well worth it. Simply spectacular. Congratulations Four Seasons! I will always find you.

Reviews.Title: “Fours Seasons Lacks the human touch”
Reviews.Author: hoyle75
Reviews.Content: I will say that the property looks and feels amazing .,, But the staff and service where down right poor for the amount of money they charge. The restaurant staff struggled to do the simple things well and the food was bland and tasteless.The check out was a shambles and I had to a expalin there over charging mistakes to get them fixed. Having stayed at other less expensive 5 star hotels in Istanbul I was dissapointed with my stay and will avoid four seasons from this point on.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Service.”
Reviews.Author: dkpot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a last minute decision to come to Istanbul to celebrate the new year. We were both a bit apprehensive about this as we usually spend our vacation time away from major cities but our anxiety was gone from the moment we landed. We had arranged for an airport transfer through the Four Seasons and were met outside our plane's gate on arrival by a Four Seasons representative who took our bags and whisked us off to the visa counter in a motorized cart. Once there, we breezed through the visa counter in minutes and were eacorted to our car which took us to the Four Seasons. We also used the private transfer for our trip back to the airport (from the FS Bosphorus) and, while it is a bit pricey ($200 euro), we were glad that we did. Again, a FS representative met us curbside and, after taking our bags and passports, quickly checked us in for our flight before escorting us to the secuirty gate. Attention was paid to each and every detail to ensure that our airport passage went as smooth as possible. This was a pleasant and welcome surprise to us in an unfamiliar airport in a foreign land. Being delayed due to a missed connection in London, we didn't arrive at the hotel until 11pm that night, but were quickly shown to our room and given several suggestions as to where we might find a bite to eat (hotel restaurants were closed for the night). Walking a short distance on the cobblestone streets, we found a great little spot for a nice meal and some relaxation after a long trip. The following morning, before breakfast, we arranged to have a private guide take us for a half day tour to familiarize ourselves with the city. The guide took us on a walking tour of Sultanahmet and its amazing sites, including The Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, The Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern, and The Grand Bazaar. The guide was very informative and gave us a good idea as to the layout of the surrounding area. If we had any complaint, it was that the guide took us to several stops along the way where we could browse the local shops. While this was something that we were interested in, we couldn't help but get the feeling that we were brought to places where our guide was getting "kickbacks" for taking us to these vendors (a bit of an annoyance but certainly not something to ruin the day). Either way, the guide was invaluable for giving us a lay of the land and, after parting ways, we were able to reasonably make our way around that part of the city on our own. As for the hotel itself, what amazed us most was the close proximity of everything to the FS. Any of the major sites were within easy walking distance of the hotel and the rooftop deck offered magnificent views at night of both the Haghia Sophia and The Blue Mosque. The Haghia Sophia seemed to be within arm's reach from the rooftop deck. Simply amazing. We were not only pleased with the beauty of the hotel, but the staff couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating. On NYE, my wife had a mishap that resulted in her hairbrush getting caught in her hair (don't ask!). The concierge not only made sure that our dinner reservation (off the premises) was pushed back multiple times, but also that a hairdresser was found within 15 minutes and brought to our room to assist her. We only stayed at the FS Sultanahmet for two days before moving onto the FS Bosphorus for a night, but thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly reccommend the Four Seasons, Sultanahmet to anyone interested in seeing the historic section of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Out of This World”
Reviews.Author: ldanieluf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fine hotels but was still amazed at the warm welcome my young son and I received. Every single staff member went out of their way to help and entertain my son. The location is perfect and the views were wonderful. A+++, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Historical building, great location for exploring Sultanhamet and enviorns!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Was in Turkey for a seven night stay, the first three nights in Istanbul, one night in Cappadocia and another three nights in Istanbul. Have always heard good things about both the Four Seasons in Istanbul so thought we would spend the first three nights in Sultanhamet and the last three nights at the Bosphorus location. Definately not disappointed in planning the trip this way. I travelled with a friend from home as well as another friend came over from Saudi to join us for our first three days in Istanbul. Chose Sultanhamet as the first legs as it seemed to be in the most historical section of Istanbul with the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosques, Bazaars, cisterns, Topkepi Palace, etc.... all within walking distance of the hotel. Most foreigners want to see these sights so figured best to stay near them at first as oppossed to travelling to them from the Bosphorus FS location. We also chose the Four Seasons as the last time I was in Turkey over 18 years ago, my hotel had a shared squatters toilet and none of us wanted to risk having that on this trip! We used a regular taxi from the International arrivals section of the Ataturk airport. There is a taxi greeter at the exit door who explains to the taxi drivers which hotel you are staying at and also will advice you how much the rate to the hotel will be! The rate on the meter was under 35 TL so with tip it was still a very good price. I know the hotel offers a pick-up service for over 100 Euro but if you can handle not being transferred in a MB you will do just fine by taxi! Once at the hotel we were greeted with the best service and attention to detail. Our friend had checked into our room early and fortunately we were upgraded from a Deluxe room to a Premier room. Seeing the three of us shared a room we had a fold-away bed which my friend said was as comfortable as any bed she ever slept in before. The bed was in the corner of the room which still gave us more than enough room in the lounge area. Our corner room had four very large windows in the main area (with automatic blinds) plus a large window in the washroom. We had a partial view of the Hagia Sofia, best seen from the bathroom. Our room was beside the newly excavated area that may or may not be the site for future expansion of the hotel. That area could also be part of the archeological park beside the Hagia Sofia. Also there was a venting stack outside of our room but all in all we were happy for the upgrade to a larger room with decent views as oppossed to a smaller room with amazing views. The room has all the amenities one would expect although I was disappointed that there was no coffee/tea/expresso maker in the room. I didn't see any info in the hotel guide either about complimentary coffee delivery to the room either which would have been a nice touch. They do have coffee, fruit and a very small pastry plate set up in the lobby and in the gym (basement a tthe far end of the hotel) in the morning but again it is not in your room so you have to get dressed to go get it yourself. We didn't eat at this property as we wanted to experience all things Turkish and we just felt the Four Seasons food would have been for more of a Westerners taste! As for attention to details, the individual hand written welcome cards were a nice touch. Remember all three names on the phone and in person also made us feel like they appreciated our business. The turn down service and room cleaning were excellent as well! Also my friend asked at the concierge for the direction to the nearest pharmacy so she could go out and buy some hair dye. The concierge simply asked for the brand and number and offered to go pick it up for her! I also had difficulty using the ATM at this and the Bosphorus location of the FS and an employee was passing by and heard that the ATM would not accept my card so the employee told me to come to the desk and they will advance me money on the room to accomodate my needs. I have never experienced that before. Nice added touches! Definately go to the top floor of this hotel and find the large and small public terraces that afford great views of the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Sultanhamet region, into the archeological park and out to the Sea of Marmara. Solovely to find on our first morning at the hotel! The one big drawback to this property was the lack of a pool. The hotel did have a nice gym and in the mens room there was a steambath but a pool would have been lovely. On the plus side one can use the pool at the Bosphorus location although the two hotels are far enough away from each other that it would be an inconvenience just to go for a swim. Having stayed at both hotels though, the Sultanhamet location, being a converted Turkish prison is by far more unique and architectually splendid than the Bosphorus location. Pluses on both sides but this local definately has more charm, character and attentive staff! The Sultanhamet location also made you feel like you were in Istanbul and not say at a FS in Chicago! The Bosphorus location, although beatifully situated on the historic body of water did feel more generic than this Sultanahmet location!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMNN
Reviews.Content: Traveled with another couple. After a cruise from Venice to Istanbul, stayed at here for a few nights post cruise. The hotel is located SO well, we loved it. The character of the city was all around us. We had a walking tour guide one day. The hotel has historical characteristics, architectural detail as well as luxury. The room was large with high ceilings that were wonderful, furnishings beautiful and comfortable, and the amenities as expected from the best. There was even free internet access from the rooms with a laptop or from the computers provided in an area. As an added bonus, the hotel offers two rooftop decks that overlook the city and has a view on to the sea. This was the perfect way to wind down after a day of exploring. Overall, the perfect hotel in the perfect location. Cannot say enough positive things!! We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore old town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Redraisinz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this Four Seasons property before moving on to another 3 nights at their Bosphorus property. Sultanahmet is the "old town" of Istanbul and most of the historical sights are great to explore from this location. Everything is geared towards the tour industry around this area, so for more authentic life of locals, the Bosphorus property and the Asian side of Istanbul is more desireable. The best part of the hotel is of course the famous Four Seasons service. No complaints here. The staff are reliable and courteous. The food is excellent. The airport transfer is fantastic, and gave us a great introduction to the city. The hotel is gorgeous albeit a little limited by being in an existing historical building. The ceilings in the rooms are very high, but strangely oppressive. The proportion of the room just didn't feel cozy and relaxing. If you get a room which is directly above the ballroom, be prepared. It didn't bother us too much, but we did notice the thumping at nights. The next street over is full of hostels, so it is a bit of a strange experience transitioning from a luxury property on one end of the street to a lot of backpackers on the other end. Another highlight is the hotel recommended personal tours. We were curious to see the difference between having our own tour guide versus being part of a larger bus tour (besides the price), so we signed up for a personal tour guide for 8 hours for our first day there. Lucky for us, we got Seda! She really set the bar for us and made our trip very enjoyable. Seda is very enthusiastic and easy-going, and her demeanor reminds us of a Turkish Kate Winslet. Having Seda as our guide is more like hanging out with a good local friend who happens to be very knowledgeable. We didn't realize how great that was until when we went to some places on our own and had to get in line for everything. Apparently with a tour guide you are allowed to bypass all the lines! She customized our day according to our "level" (including a fantastic lunch recommendation), and was very efficient with our time. And unlike a bus tour, we can ask questions at any time, all the time! Thank you Four Seasons for introducing us to Seda. See my separate review for the Four Seasons Bosphorus property.

Reviews.Title: “We have been spoiled! Simply the best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: 57TbirdLady
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a long weekend in Istanbul on the leg home of 2 week tour of Egypt, and decided to splurge on the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. We flew Turkish Airlines First Class, which provided free transport to and from the hotel, an added bonus. This is a small, intimate hotel in the middle of the historic area of Istanbul. We are no strangers to luxury travel, and this Four Seasons is simply the Best of the Best. It has earned many awards, and deserves them all. The rooms are comfortable and spacious; ours had both views of the beautiful inner courtyard and the Hagia Sophia mosque. The service providers are friendly yet professional and are trained to solve problems efficiently. We had problems contacting Turkish Airlines to arrange car transport. The concierge solved the problem with one phone call. The car even arrived as promised! We have been spoiled and can't ever consider staying at another property in Istanbul. If you can afford this hotel, please pamper yourself and book it! The only negative is the rug shop owner on the corner across from the hotel watches to see who the guests are and follows them from the hotel to the mosques. We got to know him well and assured him daily that our need for a rug had not changed! This hotel defines 5* !

Reviews.Title: “Boutique!”
Reviews.Author: YuvalBA
Reviews.Content: This wonderful luxurious hotel was, believe it or not, a prison in the not too distant past. The place has been given a face lift, turned into an enchanting warm place of relaxation. Don't miss!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location- unbelievable upgrade and service”
Reviews.Author: sek07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night while in istanbul and this hotel is in the perfect spot for seeing the main sights in Istanbul (blue mosque, hagia sophia etc..). We were upgraded from a standard room to the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE which was totally over the top. We were blown away by this gesture and it made an enormous difference to start our trip as americans not sure how we would be received in this country. The food and service is exceptional, while pricey. We hired a guide from the hotel to take us on a day trip of the sites and i highly recommend it as she was phenomenal and just a great person to boot. we learned an incredible amount and had a great day. She even brought us to a trusted rug merchant and encouraged us to negotiate further. For top notch service, and a premo location it cant be beat. we spent one night and had lunch at the other FS on the bosphorous and while that hotel is top notch as well we enjoyed staying in a peice of history (old turkish prison) and looking out our windows at the blue mosque and hagia sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny91
Reviews.Content: I actually prefer this hotel to the Four Seasons Bosphorus. The location is much more interesting. You can walk to much site seeing and the shopping is great. While the Bosphorus location is beautiful...as are the pool and Hammam...it is too far in killer traffic.... As with most Four Seasons everything to do with sleep and service was superlative. This hotel has an older, more distinctive character...... It was wonderful! My one complaint....about ALL Four Seasons is that they charge for internet access despite the high price of the rooms...which in this day and age seems a little nickel and dimish.....

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location and it's the four seasons”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: What can I say It's the Four Seasons in the prison ( redone of course ) from Midnight Express. I would absolutely recommend this one to anyone traveling to Turkey especially if you have never been there before. We were greated by the Manager and actually did check-in in our room. The hotel is in the Sultanhammet section literally a block or two from the Blue Mosque/Aya Sofia/Hippodrome. Rooms as w/any Four Seasons are sumptuous and gotta love that shower! Restaurant ok-needed to eat there first night after 2 flights but would recommend going out to eat in town-much cheaper. However I got my first taste of Turkish wine which we had w/each dinner for the next 9 days in Turkey-trust me you will be pleasantly surprised. Don't be surprised by the bill-you are paying dearly for the pampering but if you can and want hey go for it-it really is worth it We went to Bodrum and for our last night stayed back at the hotel and they nicely upgraded us Staff very friendly and accomodating-if I go back to Istanbul it's a no brainer, will stay there-where else can you go up the stairs have a drink and watch the sunset over the Blue Mosque and yes get to your room if needed BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Go to Jail and live like a Sultan”
Reviews.Author: theaestheticone
Reviews.Content: For those who want to stay in the old city, and walk to all the world class sites, this is the place. It is very expensive, but then again the finer things in life are worth the price. Four Season continues to exude its "understated elegance" brand with this property, which features an inner garden/coutyard. If you are looking for a super room/suite, ask for room 315. It has the only balcony that looks over the inner garden. The suite is perfect for that special someone and moment. As busy as the old city is, this hotel is in a quiet section and waking up to songbirds in the garden is a beautiful way to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MBtraveler89
Reviews.Content: This is one of the unique Four Seasons properties, in the same vein as the George V or the Santa Barbara Biltmore and the entire experience was on par with a stay at those two hotels. The location is tremendous and to have an after dinner drink at the roof top bar overlooking the nearby landmarks is a treat unto itself. Service was impeccable and the concierges, in particular, were excellent. Although on the small size, the exercise room was immaculate and the rooms were wonderfully furnished. I would recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Brent
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the top Four Seasons properties we have ever stayed at. We had originally planned to stay in the Ritz Carlton but, while it is a nice hotel, we found it rather out of the way. The Four Seasons Sultanahment is right in the heart of things. From the window of our room we could see Aya Sofia and were within a five minutes walk of both Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The food, while a bit pricey, was very good. The staff, however, was amazing. This is the service that you expect from a Five Star property.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Four Seasons Hotel to date”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug79
Reviews.Content: There have been alot of reviews of this hotel already so I shall try to keep this short....... We are regular Four Seasons Hotel guests having stayed now at several properties including Beverly Hills, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Amman to only name a few, but I was more than impressed with this establishment in Istanbul. It is the winner for me. It is true that it is a peaceful haven from the palava outside. Once you are through that front door there is an immediate sense of "phew! I can relax now!" We had the king deluxe room on the 2nd floor and the high ceilings gave a sense of a bigger room than it probably was. However having said that it was an excellent sized room, perfect for the 2 of us. I felt right at home and comfortable in the room and I even slept like a log which is saying something as I am a light sleeper. We appreciated and very much enjoyed the tasty morsels delivered to the room each day such as the lokum, chocolate cake, macarons and truffles. Lovely! We had breakfast each morning in the delightful courtyard surrounded by the curious sparrows and the flowers. It was a gorgeous way to begin the day. And in the evening, do enjoy a drink on the roof terrace and don't forget your camera because the view is truly out of this world. It is a stone's throw from all the major sites in the Old City (as others have reported) and make sure you try the turkish baths down the road (only if you are not shy) We also enjoyed the chartered yacht on the Bosphorus. They were two of the highlights for me. You truly cannot do better for the location in this part of town. The service was excellent and overall, the hotel exudes a certain charm and a sense of tranquility in an often overwhemling city. I highly recommend this hotel and if you do stay, then I hope you enjoy it as much as I did because I have nothing but happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel to stay at in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hpmarge
Reviews.Content: the location of the Fours Seasons Istanbul at Sultanahmet can't be beat. it is centrally located in the historical part of Istanbul with Aya Sophya, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, all within walking distance. the city is noisy but it is tranquil and peaceful at this hotel. almost all rooms face the courtyard with a few on the top floors having views of the Aya Sophya. the service is impeccable. the concierge was able to line up a tour guide for us within one hour of arrival. try out the roof top bar which has a fantastic view of Aya Sophya and distant view of the Bosphorus. the restaurant in the courtyard is equally excellent - breakfast buffet has everything. for dinner, try the Ottoman Empire menu - very very good and is updated with modern twist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: candicaneadventures
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 day stay at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet and I couldn't be happier. The accomodations were fabulous and in my opinion, worth every penny. The service was unparalleled and in fact, when the front desk did not have a certain product that was needed one of the bellmen accompanied my teenage daughter to a local drugstore laid out the money for her so that she could get what she needed and he did so in a discrete manner!!! The room was very spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was the best that I have seen in any hotel. This was really welcome for us as we had just come off of a week long cruise in the Greek Isles on a sail boat where our cabin was tiny so it felt good to stretch out. The buffet breakfast is good but a bit pricey but that is to be expected in a hotel of this type. The location of the hotel is perfect, just around the corner from all of the major attractions and also around the corner from a very busy and colorful street that has a ton of cafes and restaurants. So you can have great touring and great night life and then walk back to the tranquility of the hotel where they always welcome you back. The concierge was also very helpful in choosing restaurants and he would call ahead for us and then it was certain that we got First class treatment as guests of the hotel. If you can afford it, go all the way for the luxury of the Four Seasons, this particular hotel is full of history and the accomodations are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “It started so well!”
Reviews.Author: second row
Reviews.Content: You book at FS expecting high standards and high prices.Normally this quality chain delivers. Here we were met at the Airport and checked in smoothly and our room had a nice terrace with good views.The city centre location is unrivaled if somewhat noisy with the call to prayer dominating the rest period. Then came dinner.A nice setting in the courtyard but very pricey even by FS standards but the quality was just not up to standard.A very average rib eye steak was served with a few crushed potatoes.No veg, salad or sauces.A risotto lacked the required texture.Our complaints were muted compared to the ajoining table who were going to town berating the hard pressed staff and demanding everything from a free bottle of wine to a free meal. Breakfast was OK but the eggs on the buffett looked like they had been there since the city was known as Constantinople! Finally the hotel lost our bags delaying our departure to our Cruise ship by 25 minutes.Fortunately we were not on a tight schedule. FS you must do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but expensive”
Reviews.Author: michael1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this magnificent hotel June 7 through June 10th. Our luggage did not arrive with us from Chicago and the Hotel was helpful from the beginning in tracking it. Fortuantely we had travel insurance which allowed us a mini shopping spree for clothing. Our rooms were delightful and spotlessly clean. The hotel staff always were available and helpful and many spoke English. Appreciated the little things like complimentary umbrella on the days it rained. Breakfast was included and was delicious. Location in the old city is good for walking and seeing sites. A cab to Taskim Square is only 15 TL and cabs are easy to come by. We walked from Taskim to our hotel one fine day. It is an energetic adventure but well worth the effort and takes about an hour. Other than the shocking price of this hotel at 625 dollars/night it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It started as a prison...and didn't change that much”
Reviews.Author: chgr123
Reviews.Content: The Sultanahmet is in a great location for the key sites of Istanbul. However, the building was previously the Istanbul prison and a few things didn't change with the renovations -- most of the rooms are surrounded by the prison wall and therefore have no view. There is no swimming pool and it is a very hot city. The service and food is very nice, but the room rates are expensive for a room that feels like a basement. Crappy gym

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelanne
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Four Seasons. The room was gorgeous. Breakfast delicious and overall service was excellent. The Concierge & reception were extremely helpful and their recommendation for a restaurant was good. The location for exploring Istanbul could not be better. Close to so many historical sites and attractions that you can just walk everywhere. We would stay there again in a future visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alijes48
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location in the center of the old city, walking distance to all the places of interest. The staff is always willing to please you and to make your stay as nice as possible. We must mention Ms. Ipek Galti at the front desk for her kindness and professionalism. The food is fabulous and the rooms very comfortable. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly poor for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: MartinSarah02
Reviews.Content: We are regular Four Seasons travellers, having previously stayed at Four Seasons resorts in Las Vegas, San Diego (Aviara), San Francisco, Sharm-el-Sheikh, and Cairo. For Istanbul our first choice was of course Four Seasons, but we couldn't believe the prices. So after a bit of research (on here of course) we decided upon TomTom Suites (at the time no 1 in Istanbul on Trip Advisor). And a very good choice it was too - see our separate review. But after a couple of days we thought that a a bit of Four Seasons class would go down well. We had midday tea/coffee at the Sultanahmet and it was as fabulous as one would expect. So dinner reservation made - well it was a straight choice between fish under the Galata bridge, at not a lot, or a plush Four Seasons dinner at a price we'd be embarrassed to admit to. Started well with Gin and Tonics on the rooftop terrace, but when we moved down to the courtyard restaurant things deteriorated. Menu was very bland and difficult to find anything that grabbed us. We eventually decided upon various starters and all four of us ordered lamb as a main course. Service was poor - I was missing a starter knife, and ate my complementary amuse-bouche with the main course knife, which then sat there dirty while they cleared away, and all through the starter course. During the starters we had to ask for wine to be poured as they didn't seem too interested, and we were gasping. Then they cleared away three sets of starter plates while my wife was still eating. All poor, but not terrible? Well when the lamb arrived the waiter asked if he could open our red - great, but 10 minutes later still not there,and lamb half eaten (not a good move). Again we had to ask for the wine But the lamb itself was a disgrace. 60 Lire (Â£30) for lamb is not cheap, and for that I expect interesting flavours and textures, well cooked. Instead we had three v small medallions of lamb, tough as old boot, not cooked as ordered (my rare was so over-cooked I could hardly cut it. No vegetables whatsoever, no jus or sauce or gravy or anything, just three dried leather medallions and three figs. We ended up not paying for the main course, which I think was over-generous, for the worst meal in a long time, anywhere. They need to sort out the kitchen, quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oasis in the Center of History”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Four Seasons hotels for years and they never cease to amaze us, this hotel being no exception. Perfect location, beautiful property, and outstanding service. Our room was beautiful and had a wonderful view of the Hagia Sofia so the perfectly punctual breakfast with this view was outstanding in the morning before you walk out your door to the historical center of Istanbul. Staff was friendly and helpful and as always the Four Seasons culture of service beyond all else was in effect at this charming property. Do not miss the roof top bar for a drink as it has an incredible view. We did not eat at the restaurant as Istanbul offers so much culinary exploration but room service breakfast was excellent and on time. The former prison now luxury property is the place to stay in the Sultanahmet if you want the best. I would recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's Best?”
Reviews.Author: Ethelista
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Istanbul: If location, ambiance, service and timeless fad free style are what you want, this hotel is simply the best in Istanbul. It may not have the "profile" of others in the same bracket, but having stayed at its two main competitors the Four Seasons is my choice- peaceful, small, historic, everything done just right. Even the small gym manages to be top of the line equipment wise. It may not be the flashiest Istanbul has to offer, but its the best.

Reviews.Title: “ambiance is great ,food is OK for the price !”
Reviews.Author: kruh
Reviews.Content: We choose to dine in the seasons restaurant for the location since we could not get reservation at Tugra restaurant, We called seasons restaurant quite a couple times and we either disconnected nor they hang up on us. We still wanted to give it a shot and walked in the restaurant. We were greeted by the beautiful Turkish hostess which was the best part of the evening,we should have left after that We were told that they were booked but she had us seated last then five minutes, Restaurant employees did not have well english spoken servers nor servers that delivers service but filled with bunch of "order takers". Food took little more time that i originally expected and quality of the dishes were OK for the price we paid for.Presentation of thedishes were excellent . We strongly recommend the hotel to the friends but not the restaurantt!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we had been led to believe the Four Seasons would be”
Reviews.Author: RSE2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet for one night before moving to the Four Seasons Bosphorus (see separate review). Despite having stayed at numerous 5* hotels around the world this was our first stay at a Four Seasons hotel. This Four Seasons property is based in an old prison right next to some of the oldest attractions in Istanbul, including the Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia the latter of which is truly astounding given its age and is an absolute must see. Our room was spacious and equipped with everything you would expect. The bathroom was also large with an oversized shower, and a smallish but well shaped bath which sat under the window. The bathroom was equipped with wonderful Lâ€™Occitane toiletries, and soft heavyweight towel and robes. In short it had everything you could ever need. The bed was dressed with top quality cotton linen, perfectly fluffed pillows, and a duvet that was just so. The decor is traditional in style, but faultlessly executed. The windows are double sealed, and triple glazed, so that you do not have to enjoy the early morning call to prayer from the myriad of mosques if that is not your thing. Four Seasons have a reputation for superb service levels, and our experience bears this out. From check in to check out we were made to feel like we were genuinely important, and as if the staff genuinely wanted us to enjoy our stay. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a Four Seasons Suite room that was heavily discounted from the EUR2500 rack rate. We decided against it (mainly on cost grounds) but the suite certainly appeared to be more of the same, but with a separate lounge and a balcony. There is no swimming pool here but there is a well equipped gym. The restaurant is situated in the courtyard in the centre of the hotel and is an oasis of calm amid the madness of the old city. The breakfast buffet is highly recommended (although pricey) and the quality of food that we experienced for lunch very good - particularly the olive oil which was served with bread which was possibly the nicest we have ever had.. Wine is very expensive in Istanbul so prepare to get your credit card battered. Sarafin is a local Turkish wine and really wasnâ€™t too bad, although still in excess of Â£40 a bottle. Reservations at a local restaurant (Balakei Sabahamin - recommended for a fun atmosphere, ok food, and only 5 minutes walk from the hotel) were handled without fuss, and a confirmation sent to our room. My wife forgot her hairbrush. I called the concierge to explain, and to ask if he could send a comb up. 15 minutes later there was a knock on the door and my wife was presented with a tray of at least a dozen different (brand new) hairbrushes that they had been out and bought. Wow. If you want a central hotel, peerless service, a wonderfully aesthetic exterior, with perfect execution of more, or less, anything then you should stay at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. If you were being picky the decor cold do with a being a little more bold, and EUR20 for 24 hour internet access in this day and age really is outrageous (although you can get free Istanbul Wifi if you position your laptop carefully).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect afternoon tea at Four Seasons Hotel Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: steviecee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the perfect afternoon tea here, with Turkish champagne. The service was excellent, the cakes and sandwiches delightful and delicious, and the bill was remarkably reasonable. The piano was playing in the background, as we looked out over a perfectly tended garden, away from the hubub of Istanbul, in perfect peace and quiet after a day spent walking round the fantastic sites Istanbul offers. But what a relief to sit down, chat and enjoy a sumptuous tea in pefect weather and beautiful surroundings. Go and treat yourself like we did, you deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location for Historical Sites”
Reviews.Author: globegal
Reviews.Content: The comfort of the room and the spaciousness of the bathroom was outstanding. We were two single travelers sharing a room. While they didn't have any available rooms with two beds, they moved a "temporary" bed into the room which was the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced. The hotel is quiet and the service as expected at a hotel of this level. We experienced several restful nights at this property and only had to walk out of the hotel and make a right to access all the key sites. We even walked to The Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar from this hotel. While the general area immediately surrounding the hotel is VERY touristy, some great Turkish and authentic restaurants can be found if you're willing to travel a short distance by taxi or a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to Leave”
Reviews.Author: dojc
Reviews.Content: We have usually stayed at Starwood Hotels when travelling overseas, but as we were only in Istanbul for a few days and wanted to be close to the Tourist Sites we decided to stay in the â€˜Old Cityâ€™ part of Istanbul and so selected the Four Seasons. Well all I can say is Good Choice!! It was excellent! The hotel was originally a prison which has been extensively refurbished and is absolutely fantastic. It is close to all the tourist sites The Blue Mosque is at your door step as well as the Topkapi Palace. The staff were wonderful, the amenities superb, food exquisite and settings amazing. We were sorry to leave. We had arranged a pickup from the Airport (after an 11 hour flight from KL and arrived at 6am we decided we didnâ€™t want to muck around trying to get a taxi). We were picked up on time and taken to the Hotel and after a quick check in we were shown to our room â€“ this about 8am and the hotel staff were keen on getting us to the room â€“ to rest. Very thoughtful!! The room was beautifully appointed and modern. We were treated like Kings!! The staff always had smiling faces and so eager to please. At the entrance there is complimentary Apple tea â€“ which is outstanding (very addictive). Well the position of the Hotel is such that everything is within walking distance. Just go out of the hotel, turn right and turn right again and head towards the tramlines. Turn right and follow the tramline to go towards the Spice market, Topkapi Palace and the harbour to get the ferry for the Bosphorous cruise (15 TYR each way). Turn left and follow the Tramline to go to the Grand Bazaar and look for the sign post after about 15 minutes walk pointing to the right. Be prepared to be pestered by â€˜rug shopâ€™ salesmen who are very persistent!! But a firm No works. The Four Seasons is truly a great place to stay. Room service was prompt and food delicious. Istanbul (the Old part of the City) is steeped in history and a fascinating place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pebblescore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in feb 2010 for two nights,its a very nice botique hotel,we stayed at the four seasons room which was excellent,the hotel is on a walking distince to the blue mosque,topkapi palace,sofia,basilica cistern,and a 10 min taxi drive to the grand bazar(30 min walk). We had after noon tea at the hotel which was average.But there are some very nice restaurants near by,Balikci Sabahattin(sea food),Karakol(at the entrance of the topkapi palace) and Develis. We also watched the famous sufi show,you can ask the hotel conceirge to make the reservations,the show starts at 7.30 in the evening and its a 10 min taxi drive from the hotel,and it costs 40 turkish liras per peson.

Reviews.Title: “the best service, the only location to stay, unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: saltireblue
Reviews.Content: Stay at Four Seasons Sultanahmet within easy walking distance of virtually all of the historic sites in Istanbul and you will not regret it. The service was excellent and it was the staff and management that make it the best. We did upgrade to the 'warden's room - a split level suite and we can recommend it. There is a sun terrace and the turkish tasting menu in the restaurant was fabulous for dinner. Try the buffet on Sunday lunchtime. It is not cheap but when you do pay more you should get this kind of experience - we would rate it one of the best hotels we have stayed in around the world. We stayed at both Four Seasons Hotels in Istanbul and while the other on the Bosphorus was great too it was more expensive and more for business and conference and much larger. Tip - for 1.5tl (about 1 dollar/euro) you can get a ferry across the Bosphorus to Kadikoy on Asian side where you will not be hassled and where just up the hill in a proper bazaar style shopping area you will find a great Turkish restaurant called Ciya - either side of the street - we tried them both and you will discover real Turkish food is delicious and a third of the price of the tourist side in Europe. Also do not miss the underground cistern or the Bazaars.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Rooms, Food, and Location at a Price”
Reviews.Author: NYCWGV
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, rooms, and food at this Four Seasons. The staff are unbelievably professional and attentive. The food is great and the rooftop bar is stunning at night. The inner courtyard where breakfast is served is an oasis in Sultanahmet. My only comment is that the hotel is so professionally run, well-designed, and Westernized that you can forget you're in Istanbul when in your room and in the halls. So if you want a more authentic Istanbul hotel experience, this is not the place for you. But you'll miss out on huge rooms, great showers, and a phenomenal breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...near the main sites”
Reviews.Author: TransATL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Nov 2009. I loved the hotel's lovely grounds, services and my room. I paid for a significant upgrade to what was otherwise probably the best suite in the hotel. I'm not sure what the normal rooms are like. The hotel is particularly close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the sultan's palace. Those main sites are within a 5 minute walk. So if location is important to you - this hotel cannot be rivaled. I did not see a single hotel -- of any quality -- closer to the sites than the Four Seasons. I would say the hotel courtyard restaurant is nothing special, particularly compared to the many cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. So, by all means, have breakfast at the hotel, but be more adventurous for lunch and dinner. Don't get me wrong -- dinner was good there -- but I would try other places. The great thing about the Four Seasons? You can just rock up and they handle everything from posting letters, getting you a great tour guide, or changing currency. The Four Seasons Sultanahmet was just like other Four Seasons in this respect. Here's a tip: Do not use the hotel's airport shuttle. It was crazily over-priced. I recall it was 90 euros - one way! I used "Backpackers Travel Agency" and it was 35 euros round trip. And that was for a Mercedes van with fruit juice offered. The driver met us inside the airport, etc. - it was perfect, reliable service at a fraction of the hotel's price. And one last note: I read many off-putting things about Istanbul such as how much of a hassle the airport is. Ignore it all. The airport was modern and easy to deal with. I found Istanbul to be a great city, easy to navigate and full of friendly people. The only hassles are the cafe owners who tend to be a bit loud as you walk past -- they want your business and try very hard to lure you in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HongKongMember
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the Cirigan Palace a number of times, decided upon a location closer to the sights for this visit with my wife. For certain, the location is excellent for sightseeing, though as other reviewers have commented, you may need to take a taxi to find good food, though there is a fantastic seafood reasturant within walking distance. The hotel itself is a stylish renovation of an old jail with rooms around a central courtyard where the only restaurant is located. As you would expect from 4 Seasons, decor is to a high standard, though we did feel like declining the offered upgrade as the offered room on the lower ground floor (think legs outside the window) was dark and uninspiring. Still, given that we rarely stay in the room during hours of light, we accepted. Staff, and in particular the concierge, very helpful and knowledgeable. For us, downside would have to be the restaurant. Breakfast was OK, but our needs here are always simple. We tried lunch one day, quite bland and so-so quality. The space is darkened and candle-lit for dinner, but you really cannot hide the fact it is more coffee shop than restaurant. Food at dinner better than lunch, but there are better places to eat around town so my advice would be "call the taxi". The bar was disappointing in terms of atmosphere, best idea is cocktails on the roof garden, though the call to prayers from nearby speakers can drown out conversation for a while, but that's all part of the city. Certainly the views are nowhere near as good as being on the Bosphorus, but then it's the location that would draw you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: PortoLiberty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Four seasons sultanahmet between 14 to 17 november (deluxe room), and loved every moment! The location is the best if you want to know the old Istanbul. You can walk to the blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace and the byzantine cistern within a few steps. There are plenty of restaurants just close to the hotel where you can get dinner, if you go down the street of the hotel. Wonderful service. Very comfortable bed (king size), spacious room, very good bathroom. We also visit the grand bazar, the spice bazar and the Galata Tower (this one you can't miss, at the top you will get the 360Âº view of Istanbul) So, if you like to walk and have a wonderful time at Istanbul donÂ´t hesitate and book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “My friend got a nasty food poisoning from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: semush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have enjoyed plenty of Four Seasons hotels around the world so when I was in Istanbul for a business trip in early November I made the effort to take my friend to FS Sultanahmet for lunch. We didn't have time to eat anything at all the whole day. We had only Turkish tea and bottled water so we were very hungry by the time we ordered our food which was around at 4 pm. I couldn't finish my pide which was very salty, tasted her caeser salad but didn't like the cream sauce so I left the meal half hungry. My friend's hunger got better of her so she finished all her pizza and salad. After the meal we went back to our meetings. A couple of hours later my friend complained that the food was too heavy and she could not digest it. Around 8.30-9 pm she started feeling not well. We hurried back to the hotel. By 10 pm she was seriously sick in the toilet throwing up and having diarrhea. Because I had experienced food poisoning before, I knew that she needed to remain hydrated and wait until the poison left her system. Going to a hospital while she could not really leave the toilet didn't feel logical. Her situation improved by the next morning and she managed to retain some water. The fact that we both did not eat anything at all that day, and 4 hours after consuming the salad creme she got sick confirmed my suspicions that she had typical dairy food poisoning. We ended up missing our early flight to Izmir and delayed our meetings. The next day we called the hotel to complain. All the staff including the hotel manager was very unhelpful. At first he claimed that it might be our own personal hygene. The hotel's doctor wanted us to go to a hospital and get some tests done which we did not have the time or the energy to do at all. The kitchen manager who was very arrogant insisted that since their kitchen is checked and certified it cannot be their fault. I felt like we were being told off by every one we spoke to. We managed to get a half hearted apology and reimburstmant of the meal; however they refused to compensate us for our plane tickets that we had to buy for the 2nd time because of this unpleasant incident. The kitchen manager gave me her email adress to follow up and seemed happy to have ended the conversation when we could no longer talk to her because we needed to make our way to the airport. We could not follow up this incident after coming back to our countries. My friend had to deal with her sick parents and I got busy with my own life. However I am very surprised and disappointed about feeling so let down by such a reputable hotel chain. This incident stained otherwise a very pleasant trip for us. Worst of all I felt really ashamed and responsible for this experience my friend had to go through on her very first trip to Turkey. Being Turkish myself I wanted to show her our traditional hospitality at its best but it was a wrong choice. I would never step a foot in any of the FS's in Turkey ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SFRLondon
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to visit Istanbul for a while and finally decided to go. We had heard excellent things about the four seasons properties from friends so we decided to break our short trip into 2 days at Sultanahmet and 2 at the Bhosporous property. After we got to the Sultanahmet property we decided to spend all the time at this property. The hotel was kind enough to cancel the resevation at the Bhosporous property and extend our stay. The hotel is situated in a perfect location to explore the old city. The Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Cisterns are all within 5 mins walk, if that. The hotel is a haven of peace and tranquility from the hussel and bustle of the world outside its doors. The constant grind of carpet sellers and any other object they can sell you. Within the walls of the hotel you are cosetted. The staff are attentive but not overly attentive. Its is not a large property so it retains a boutique atmosphere. The concierges are excellent in their knowledge of the city. We took our son who is 7 and thought it may be an issue as the hotel doesn't have a kids club but the staff made every effort to keep him happy when we were in the hotel which wasn't often. Our only niggle with the hotel was that it has essentially one restaurant in the courtyard where they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. We were never at the hotel for lunch so can't comment. The food for dinner is european food which is OK but coming to Turkey i expected something Turkish. The food is OK but not exceptional. The breakfast is buffet and ala carte. The buffet is not as extensive as many of the other four seasons i have been to. The best part is having tea in the coutyard in the evening, weather permitting with some delicious Baclava. These are minor criticisms. The rooms are typically four seaons excellence. Should you require internet access you will have to pay in your room. I cannot understand why four seasons does this as most people will seldom ever use it so why not make it complimentary. The hotel brings all sorts og goodies to your room complimentary each day from Baclava to chocolates. All in all a great hotel in a superb location to explore an interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- must place to stay for first timer”
Reviews.Author: DrDBA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service and property in the primo spot in Istanbul at very high prices -- but, worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four Seasons Experience - Great”
Reviews.Author: pbannister
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. The hotel is a standard Four Seasons, great service, great rooms. The one standout is the location. It really is in a phenomenal location in Istanbul. You are a 2 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, etc. Just such a great base. Unfortunately not many non-touristy dining options around, but a 15 lira cab ride will get you to plenty of cool places in Beyoglu. If you can afford it, it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location!”
Reviews.Author: pickles80
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to Istanbul for my anniversary. I did intensive research into hotels and was impressed with the two Four Seasons properties. They did not disappoint. We spent 2 nights at the Sultanahmet location. The location is ideal for all the sightseeing points. You are just steps away from all the major attractions and this made the extra money worth it. The concierge was exceptional with restaurant recommendations and shopping. We also had a transfer from the airport to the hotel which added to the experience. The food at the hotel was average, we had breakfast included in our room rate so we ate this there.This is not a cheap hotel, but you pay for the service. We had a level above the standard room which was on a higher floor with a terrace. I would not recommend the standard rooms as they all tend to be on the first floor and seem to be noisier. After two days we transferred to the Four Seasons Bosphorous property for a very different, but also outstanding experience. I would highly recommend the Four Seasons hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons loves kids!”
Reviews.Author: sailorFaith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanamet for a week in August with our 2.5 year old grandson. Everyone could not have been nicer. From the tiny slippers and robe to the coloring books to a fabulour Jr. menu (actually we ate from it too. It was half the price of the regular menu. I mean filet mignon and brocolli for $12!!!) everything was just great. The staff - as I hav found at other Four Seasons - took care of our every need even anticipating some needs before we had them. The staff were charmed by Ben and he was delighted with them. It is a wonderful city for kids with lots to see and do. We took a trip up the Bosphorus on a ferry with a nice lunch at the last stop. And then we took another ferry to the Prince's Is. and stopped at the last one for a carriage ride up to the top ofthe island (no cars allowed on the island). Ben loved the "horsies" and we loved the views and the wonderful old houses from all time periods. Reminded us a bit of Nantucket. Because we were being "granny-nanny (and grandad) for Ben for our own child who was there on behalf of the American government we were able to take advantage of the meeting rate. Without that the cost would be very high - but worth every penny. It is sparkling clean, efficient, charming, comfortable has marvelous food and staff. Cannot say enough. Faith Andrews Bedford www.faithandrewsbedford.com

Reviews.Title: “Historic Location”
Reviews.Author: Willolot
Reviews.Content: I saw this Hotel on a travel channel "20 best hotels" program. It is a fantastic oasis of calm right in the middle of a busy part of the city. Locatied very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, The Byzantine Cistern and the Grand Bazaar it is an ideal venue for exploring some fo the most famous sites in the fantastic city. The rooms are beautifully frunished, the gardens are manicured perfectly and the service from the staff is brilliant. When the doorman says "welcome back" as you re-enter the hotel you really believe he really means it. It is expensive, but if you can afford it, you will be made to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: EWLTexas
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel well located in the center of Istanbulâ€™s old town within easy walking distance of major sites and interesting shopping streets. Its public areas are handsomely decorated with beautiful fabrics, paintings and furniture that evoke the feel of Turkeyâ€™s past. Additionally, the staff was professional, helpful and quite friendly. It has a lovely rooftop terrace with impressive views that, unfortunately, was too cold to use while we were there (last week of April), but did offer a great place for photographs of the surrounding mosques. The hotelâ€™s bedrooms are nice sized and well appointed. We spent five nights in one of the suites (separate sitting and bedroom, plus a small half bath off the seating area, in addition to the spacious bathroom attached to the bedroom). It overlooked the pretty interior courtyard and garden restaurant where a sumptuous buffet breakfast was served. Some of the guest rooms have impressive views of the Ayah Sophia and/or Blue Mosqueâ€¦worth looking into if you enjoy having a view. Wifi is available in the rooms at a surprisingly hefty cost, but free in the lobby and business center. On our first night after the long flight from the states, we had a delicious dinner in the hotelâ€™s restaurant. After that, we tried restaurants both close by and a cabâ€™s drive away. Given the heavy traffic from 6 to 9 in the evening, my recommendation would be to limit your restaurant choices to those within walking distance from the hotel. One night we spent over an hour trying to get to a restaurant where our travel agent had made reservations for us! The concierge at the hotel will know what nearby restaurants are currently best.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons at Sultanahmet is For Real!”
Reviews.Author: SCB_JR
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 incredible nights at the 4 Seasons Sultanahmet and one at the 4 Seasons Bosphorus (see review if interested). Both completely different in feel, but I couldnâ€™t ask for a better venue than Sultanahmet. Arrival and check-in was easy and efficient and attentive. Our suite was truly exceptional with every i dotted and t crossed. Comfortable, luxurious and complete â€¦ from the bath to living quarters. Attention to detail was superb from name recognization from the front desk and concierge to turn down service â€¦ all impressed! Food â€¦ Breakfast buffet was weak overall. Ask for an omelets or something specific as their â€œscrambled eggsâ€� needed to be drained before consumption. Dinner was excellent. Certainly get the Ottoman Delight, as it was wonderful!! Room service was timely and delivered at 5:30 am as we had an early flight out that morning. The concierge was extremely helpful directing us first night out to â€œBalikci Sabahattinâ€� (fish restaurant) which was just terrific! Well worth the 10 minute walk. Other recommendations were equally appreciated. The location, literally steps away from some of the MUST sees, is without comparison. Walking through the area, steps you back to another time â€¦ but â€¦ get out early before the tour busses get â€œin frontâ€� of you! The only downside is the overall cost factor. It is expensive, but was well worth it for the overall experience and entertainment value!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMich
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day anniversary trip to Istanbul. Having not visited Istanbul before, we found the peace and tranquility of the hotel perfect for escaping from the clutches of the friendly but tiring traders in the streets and bazaars. The service was exemplary but personalised, the room delightful and the food (breakfast and supper) delicious. The hotel is perfectly placed for visiting the old city sights, museums and bazaars and is close enough to pop back for a rest and freshen up before continuing with the day's itinerary. The 5 a.m. call to prayer from the Blue Mosque, literally on the far side of the terrace was heart-stopping on the first night but we soon got used to it and in fact it just added to the feeling of being immersed in this wonderful, historic city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic service and true luxury”
Reviews.Author: solarbea
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in March and each time service was perfect. We were met at the airport and guided to the hotel where everything was done before we had realised that it needed to be done (parts of check-in already completed to save time, luggage already in the room when we arrived, flowers etc). Both times, the rooms were perfect; proper luxury which many hotels claim but few manage. Upon departure, we were guided back to the airport, through check-in and to passport control before the concierge wished us on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. We had a wonderful stay. First, the hotel is literally 5-10mins walk from all the main sites & it's an oasis of calm in the chaos. All the staff we dealt with, reception, restaurant, concierge, door men, porters, cleaners were lovely and helpful. The room was large and very comfortable - even if the decor is a bit dated. We had a partial view of the blue mosque. House keeping is impeccable and they were happy to bring up and leave an iron & board in our room. The food is good in the restaurant although we preferred the lighter meals you can get in the bar. If you're there on a sunday the brunch buffet is fabulous. The concierge recommended both stylish up market & local relaxed places to eat that were good. When we went out in the suburbs to see St Saviour in Chora church the doorman negotiated a price with the taxi driver who took us there, waited while we looked & then drove us back to the Topkapi palce. Really i couldn't fault them. Go up on the roof terrace & see the sunset over the blue mosque its great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully situated for viewing many of the most popular tourist sites. Service is excellent. Our room was clean, large , lovely and quiet with a view of the construction site but little else. In room tea /coffee would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely oasis in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: Emeritus01
Reviews.Content: The second time at the Four Seasons was just as lovely as the first. This is due to its position next to the Hagia Sophia, and the really friendly and helpful staff who always greet you with a smile. The flower arrangements are absolutely beautiful.The taxis which come to the hotel are efficient, take the shortest route and always use the meter, unlike a number we just picked up on the street. The hotel will cash travellers cheques without commission and base it on that day's exchange rate. Last visit we wanted to see the Florence Nightingale musum and the concierge faxed them a request and followed up to make sure we were included on the list (required as it is in a military base). The rooms are large and extremely comfortable and the bathrooms are GORGEOUS. Although I love this hotel, at the considerable price I have some reservations. The breakfasts are amazingly overpriced and its better to get them included in the room price or eat out - there is a roof top terrace restaurant across the road with great views. The lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room is noticeable, and there were only 2 computers in the business centre, one which didn't work for the time I was there. The main problem though is the lack of any real turkish feeling about the hotel - it is modern 5 star bland when it could have been absolutely breathtaking with a bit more courage. It has modern paintings of Isnik tiles rather than the real deal, and could be a luxury hotel any where in the world.This is a shame as the hotel is an original building and prides itself on its architectural origins.The lack of a pool is also disappointing but I understand there is one planned above the extensive archaeological excavations of the Bucholeon palace adjacent , when they are finished. If you are cashed up and want a trouble-free and luxurious place to stay in Istanbul in the heart of things, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Lucklucky
Reviews.Content: After staying for several days in Ciragan, we moved to Four Seasons at Sultanahmet to be closer to the sightseeings. The hotel's location is excellent for the sightseeings but quite far from the shopping malls. The averall experience was pleasant but can't be compared to a great stay in Ciragan Kempinski.The staff was very polite, the concierge service is very good. But overall it was just an average stay. Maybe we were quite unlucky, but it seemed they kept forgetting small and important things for us. 1)We waited for our breakfast for ages on Sunday eventhough it was just fresh vegetables and a cheese plate. 2) The breakfast in the hotel is very very modest. Doesn't worth the money you're being charged. 3) Our safe box didn't work. After we asked for it to be repaired, we heard from them no more. 4) They didn't deliver the newspaper in the morning, even though we asked. 5)They never brought us a shower sponge, after saying "Yes madam, in a second". 6)Our bath cork didn't function. 7)The room was so so, no view, no balcony.Even though it wasn't the standard one. 8)The ATM machine didn't work for several days 9) we were not greeted by name on our arrival I am not being picky. It's still a very nice and cosy boutique type hotel but we stay a lot at different 5 star hotels around the world and i expect the stay to be immaculate and enjoyable for the money you pay. However, I should admit, the Seasons restaurant is fantastic. The staff is very attentive and the service is one of the best compared to the restaurants in Istanbul. The food is delicious. Try the Ottoman menu. It's fantastic!!! The wines are great too.The restaurant experience was indeed amazing. Maybe if we didn't stay in Ciragan(where we were treated like Kings) several days prior to Four Seasons, we would have a better impression.Still I can recommend it to those looking for a quiet and peaceful place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THECLEVERADVISOR
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, good breakfast. Clean. A bit kistsch but nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: returnjourney
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons at Sultanahmet is converted from an old prison used in the early part of the 20th century to house dissident politicians and writers. The conversion into a luxury Four Seasons property has made excellent use of the original architectural features and created an international hotel which, with only 65 rooms, still manages to have a boutique feel. We got a great welcome and on request were upgraded to a better room overlooking the inner courtyard - a haven of peace after the bustle of Istanbul's streets. The rooms are large and well appointed. There's a complimentary fruit basket in the room each day. There is also the usual minibar but it would be nice if there were also tea and coffee-making facilities in the room. The hotel itself was very quiet when we were there - as was Istanbul generally it being out of season. The only slight disappointment was the hotel breakfast - we longed for the sumptuous buffets you get in some places instead of the rather indifferent quality of the cooked food in the mornings from the hotel kitchen. Other than that, staying in the Four Seasons was a real pleasure and its proximity to the major sites - Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace etc - is a big bonus. Special mention should be made of the concierge service who went out of the their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Elenriel
Reviews.Content: We knew within minutes of our arrival that we had made the write decision to stay at the Four Seasons Sultananhmet. The archetecture is exceptional. A very sympathetic restoration of an old prison, with outstanding attention to detail, leaving the many of the original features of the prison, but resored to true luxurious fitment that the Four Seasons has become known for. The location could not be more central, with all the 'old town' sights such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topikia Palace, Hippodrome, Cisterns, Grand Bazaar, Spice market all within easy walking distance. You get a sense of being off the beaten track however as the hotel is in a wondeful neighbourhood full of wiinding streets and brightly coloured buildings. The streets are filled with less expensive bars and roof top restaurants, and less pushy merchants in a range of interesting shops. You can walk for hours in the district that is so historic and full of local colur. I cannot comment on the restaurant or bar, as we had so many options around the hotel, we didn't eat there at all. The staff are exceptionaly well trained, and anticipated our every need. Very helpful and genuinely friendly without being in your face. We were upgraded to a beautiful expansive suite on the third floor (323), with views of both the sea and the beautifully manicured gardens of the courtyard, for a moderate cost.
